section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - wireless network specialist ii (tec10088-17)job description wireless network specialist ii - tec10088-17description ready to take your technical expertise to the next level?    maintaining best in class mobility services is the wireless network operations team’s goal. we take pride in what we do, as we are all an integral part of ensuring our customers come first. this team is collaborative and supportive in sharing their technical expertise, and are looking for you - someone who embraces opportunities for continual improvement and draws from their expertise to make a meaningful impact.   position overview:   reporting to the director of wireless network operations, you will perform network assurance functions related to the telus mobility core network and provide technical guidance to other technical resources.   responsibilities:   you will take on both technical and communication roles:   subject matter expert:  provide technical guidance and act as a focal point for questions, issues and/or process clarification as requested by other technical resources represent the wireless network operations team at meetings regarding impacts, resources and scheduling conflicts; identify issues, resolve or refer to others; ensure testing has been completed and issues identified and/or escalated develop service based kpis used to measure and monitor service health and performance work in partnership with other teams to implement hardware, software, firmware, product change upgrades and commissioning of network elements/services work directly with vendors and internal departments to develop procedures and mops for new software and patches identify opportunities for improvement to technical processes and procedures; resolve or recommend solutions provision, commission, test, maintain and repair switching/data network elements and services provide trouble analysis (i.e. testing, fault isolation and repair functions using logs, alarms and operational measurements) develop preventative maintenance procedures and intervals for all areas of network equipment according to standards and/or specifications initiate discussion and/or respond to queries; provide trouble details, progress updates and confirm resolutions directly with vendors/internal teams review technical bulletins, assess impacts and communicate to other technical resources complete administrative requirements (i.e. time and expense)    collaborative communicator:  promote the sharing of information (i.e. methods, procedures, and network performance management best practices) articulate technical information to large audience with various levels of technical knowledge base, including senior leaders that may lack a deep technical understanding of internetworking technology solutions confidently represent the team and supported network elements as the technical prime during any incident management situation lead the team troubleshooting calls by pursuing multiple restoration paths and engaging multiple parties for support working knowledge of current and emerging wireless networks knowledge of network technology, architecture, transmission and power elements demonstrated knowledge of and ability to isolate and resolve troubles   qualifications required skills & abilities:   proven ability to lead within the mobile switching office groups ability to mentor others related to technical matters professional oral and written communications skills self-motivated, works well with minimal or no direct supervision ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaboratively with other departments maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment demonstrated planning and organizing skills ability to work shifts and be on-call ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks, including potentially competing/conflicting priorities and time pressures ability to both identify and resolve conflict between internal teams and external partners ability to exhibit sound and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex information with inherent confidence a bias for action and sense of urgency - the ability to not only plan and delegate, but to lead and/or take the initiative to ensure that actions and projects are on track must be able to remain calm and focused in stressful situations which includes the ability to extract information using methodical troubleshooting processes focused on service restoration leads by example of being held accountable  required knowledge:   strong tcp/ip and security protocols understanding with experience in complex troubleshooting demonstrated expertise and working experience with networking/security protocols tcp/ip, mpls, bgp, isis, ospf, ip sec, ips, ids strong knowledge of juniper & cisco routers and switches, juniper & checkpoint firewalls intermediate understanding of mobility technologies, ims, lte, umts, volte and call flows knowledge of safe work practices, safety rules and regulations able and eager to utilize knowledge and experience to assist the development of teammates through structured p2p coaching/mentoring excellent knowledge of computers, software applications and job related systems  required education:   post-secondary education in computer sciences, electronics and/or telecommunications or equivalent experience  required experience:  5 years working experience with wireless switching/data network elements experience in installation, maintenance and/or commissioning of network elements experience with packet capture and analysis products such as netscout ccnp certification red hat certification nfv – capabilities is an added advantage big data analytics working knowledge an asset  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.


we offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process.  supportphones & devicescoverage & travelaccount & billingmanage accountgetting startedservicesrepairsactivate your devicetelus sitestelus digital labsbusinessenterprisehealthinternationalinternet of thingsneighbourhood forumaccessibilitytelus wisetelus blogabout uscareersregulatorywireless code checklistinvestor relationsservice termssecurityprivacyuser termssustainabilitycommunitycustomer feedbackcontact uscontact ustwitterfind a storefacebookyoutubegoogle+linkedin

description

position at ddb canada


data marketing analyst the marketing analyst will pair their considerable digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets.you will:work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategyimprove profitability and drive revenue through creating effective kpis and optimization of metrics that affect themguide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of developmentlead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data miningensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and trainingdrive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark datainterpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needsuse advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environmentfacilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offerscreation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualizationyou must have:curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environmentundergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentationdeep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communicationsexperience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformationkeen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadershipa strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-orientedexperience with marketing attribution modelingdemonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including kpi development, tagging and report automation.intermediate level capabilities with adobe analytics and/or google analyticsdemonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projectsbonus points for:experience with tableauproficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)experience designing, supporting, executing and interpreting research projects and experimentsexperience with digital qualitative research platformsexperience with tag management platforms (dtm, gtm, tealium iq, ensighten manage)experience with ad tech integrations for adobe analytics, domo, anametrics or google analytics premiumwe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

date posted: 
sep 29, 2017
                                

 reference code: 27841-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionas part of our corporate financial planning and analytics (fp&a) team, this role acts as a finance business partner and provides proactive financial analysis and business advisory support to our business services as well as to business leaders within enabling area nationally. this position will support and report to the senior manager, and will be located at our head office in downtown toronto. the ideal candidate for this role will be a highly independent and motivated individual, who is able to work and communicate effectively across functions with strong analytical experience, customer service attitude and strong financial/accounting knowledge.
key responsibilities and areas of involvement include, but not limited to: 
- support fp&a team and enabling area fabs in any capacity required to deliver financial advisory and business support including the following:

proactively support the enabling area fabs in period-end reporting and analysis, year-end close, financial planning and forecasting, ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required
provide ongoing business insights versus plan or forecast including presentations to the leadership team on periodic financial results
provide analysis of period variances to provide insight and help drive next steps
prepare operational cost analysis encompassing variance analysis of non-client expenses
provide a future focused outlook to help to identify pending issues and identify opportunities for improvement in the delivery of this project
research, analyze and respond to ad hoc requests for financial information from within the firm
support period-end reporting activities and analysis including appropriate accruals and journal entries where required

- participate in the annual plan and quarterly forecasting process, ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required
- ongoing assessment of the operational strategy, targets, processes and policies in support of the business units’ objectives by supporting better management reporting, information flow and management and business processes

proactively look to improve operations, processes and policies to improve alignment with business plan

- participate in firm wide finance initiatives, fostering integration and collaboration across regions and services
- build relationships with finance peers supporting other services and reporting experts to share best practices and insights
external posting qualifications- education and experience

bachelor’s degree and/or a professional certification in: finance & accounting or related education
2-4 years or related years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience

- technical foundation

working knowledge of finance and accounting (debits/credits, accruals, income statements vs balance sheets vs cash flow statements etc.)
advanced excel skills: pivot tables, lookup formulas, conditionals
knowledge of ms excel, word, powerpoint, visio, financial reporting/project tracking and or database experience a plus
knowledge of sap preferred

 
·        key qualities and abilities:

ability to thrive in an environment of change
ability to adapt quickly and learn new tasks independently
accountable, responsible and responsive
excellent organization skills, able to manage competing priorities
strong attention to detail, analytical and problem solving skills
communicate effectively & tactfully with personnel on all levels
collect relevant facts quickly and provide recommendations
ability to make decisions, generate bold, creative ideas to improve processes
team oriented and works well independently
french, spanish language skills would be an asset (verbal and written)

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

job openings


data and reporting analyst
 – toronto, ontario


apply for this job




employment type
full-time


minimum experience
mid-level










horizn is looking for a data and reporting analyst in toronto. 
horizn helps enterprise companies accelerate market adoption of their new products and digital technology at lightning speed.  we are in massive growth mode and are offering an amazing opportunity for highly experienced professionals to capitalize on the momentum.
 
about you
 
we are looking for a highly motivated, energetic and outgoing data and reporting analyst to service our internal and external customers.  you have a passion for unlocking the stories hidden within platform data, and are able to communicate complex concepts to business stakeholders so they can take action.
 
you are looking to join a growing, entrepreneurial team, and are seeking to further your career in the exciting field of analytics.
 
responsibilities


provide support to horizn’s customers through detailed reporting and analytics.


derive recommendations based on analysis that support key customer success objectives. 


generate ad-hoc reporting as required by the customer to support campaigns, new features, roi analysis, program health.


build best practices for reporting dashboards and communicate with internal teams to help set expectations during the customer onboarding process.


utilize analytics to benchmark customers by industry, size, location, and other metrics to provide actionable insights.


work with internal teams to provide feedback on how customers are using their programs – highlight areas to improve for future enhancements.


 
desired skills and experience:



have completed at minimum a bachelor’s degree in a relevant quantitative discipline.


2-3 years as an analyst for customer data considered an asset.


excellent knowledge and proven fluency with ms excel and data manipulation techniques (pivot tables, formulas, filters, macros, etc.)


proficient in web analytics tools such as google analytics and campaign monitor.


ability to write, modify and analyze sql code (sequel pro, mysql).


independent, highly organized and detail oriented with the ability to meet deadlines and manage expectations at different levels.

title: Senior Associate, Data Assurance & Analytics Solutions
text:
pwc canada jobs - job details












                               canada    français english       pwc home industries research and insights services private companies up front tm press room events                   ?

jobs homesearch  openingssearch  resultscurrent pagejob  details   

job details job 1 of 1   apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs      position id  11157br   title  senior associate, data assurance & analytics solutions   line of service  assurance   job type  full-time   city  on - toronto   job description  the best opportunities to let your knowledge, talent and skills flourish. our risk assurance services group (ras):pwc is continuing to grow our risk assurance practice to add even more value to our clients.  risk assurance involves much more than identifying and managing threats to our clients’ businesses - it’s about discovering where risk mitigation strategies can be converted into business opportunities.  we are looking for exceptional people to join the practice at an associate level. we are looking to find our future leaders… people who have the vision and foresight to take their career to the next level and be part of a winning team. the risk assurance services practice is currently seeking individuals to join our team based in toronto. the opportunity: senior associate - process and data assurance & analytics solutions (pdaas), risk assurance servicespwc provides industry-focused assurance, advisory and tax services within the private and public industry sectors.  the ras pdaas practice helps our clients increase confidence in their processes, controls and enhance how they manage risk by leveraging the power of data.  the four key service offerings within pdaas are process & controls advisory, audit execution, data assurance & analytics and enterprise systems & general risk control (grc) solutions.   data assurance & analytics services build and provide assurance on data accumulation, analysis & reporting engines that facilitate decision making processes for external & internal audit, risk & compliance functions, operational support and other types of data intensive projects.   enterprise systems services  provide assessments on enterprise risk planning (erp) configuration, security and role design (pre & post go-live) and grc services enable clients to manage compliance and risk more effectively using technology.  associates will be responsible for delivering multiple client engagements and engagement teams across a variety of data analytics, enterprise systems, business process controls advisory, governance and other assurance projects. candidates must have a strong commitment to providing excellence in client service and a demonstrated ability of producing high quality results. strong interpersonal skills are required to contribute in maintaining key client relationships. excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential. requirements:undergraduate degree in business, management information systems (mis) or data management fields; 3-5 years of experience successfully delivering data analytics, data assurance, erp and/or grc projects within a professional firm or internal audit/compliance function; demonstrated expertise with data analytics & transformation tools (e.g. acl, sql, tableau, qlik); demonstrated exposure to established commercial erp and/or cloud based solutions (e.g. sap, oracle, ms dynamics, workday, salesforce); excellent time management skills and ability to deliver concurrent projects; superior communication (english - oral and written) and interpersonal skills that allow you to thrive in a team environment; demonstrated ability to work in a multitasked, fast-paced and changing environment; proven organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills; commitment to providing excellent client facing service; other assets:energy, utilities, financial services, or public sector industry experience prior financial statement audit or internal audit experience travel:this position is located in toronto and candidates must be receptive to possible travel throughout canada. pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. we encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. apply for our opportunities today. this is a place that will inspire you to be at your best each and every day. your application today is tomorrow’s opportunity. pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime    apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

position summary
location:243 consumers road, toronto, ontario, m2j 4w8 canadatake ownership and find more ways to care about our local store owners in a career at shoppers drug mart central office / store support.  provide great service, specific expertise and actionable advice to support associate-owners and their staff in delivering the best health, beauty and convenience services to canadians.why this role is important?we are hiring a sr. manager, health & wellness consumer insights. reporting directly to the sr. director, pharmacy, health & wellness consumer insights, the incumbent will be responsible for enabling data, managing and developing metrics, performing analysis and recommendations in support of driving consumer insights for health & wellness business initiatives across the lcl enterprise.what you'll do:leading the effort to identify priority h&w use cases and key performance indicators (kpis) to focus data enablement & analytics capability with the health & wellness (h&w) business teams and other stakeholderscollaborate with both business and it stakeholders to develop requirements and recommendations to enhance existing systems or build new technologies and tools to enable data for h&w-related programsevangelize the use of data, analytics and consumer insights to optimize the customer journey and to influence stakeholders to further leverage customer-centric design thinking for h&w-related programsleading the development of the h&w data enablement roadmap and play a critical role in helping the organization execute on this key deliverablemanage the design and implementation of an analytical framework to respond to key strategic questions from the pharmacy and health & wellness teamsdrive a continuous improvement culture by introducing or enhancing existing analytical techniques on the team to drive more efficient, actionable and impactful business insights with the lens of the consumerleverage data sources available across the entire loyalty & consumer insights team to drive both quantitative and qualitative analysiscollaborate with data experts (internal and external resources) to build and extract appropriate and accurate data sets to support complex analyses to drive business resultsadvance departmental capabilities through mentoring, coaching, and cross-collaboration with other colleagues in the loyalty & consumer insights teamwhat you'll need:post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business, statistics, engineering, healthcare or related analytical programsgreater than five years of business analysis experience; people management / leadership experience is preferredstrong communication and presentation skills - experience explaining complex technical topics to varied audiences and adept at presenting to leadersability to set and prioritize work across the team amid competing demandshigh level of initiative to take on projects from start to finish with minimal supervision“out of the box” thinker who wants to challenge the status quo, think creatively, and drive change and innovation across the organizationexceptionally strong team player who has proven success in working within cross-functional teamsstrong ms office (excel, access, powerpoint) skills are requiredexperience with analytical tools and systems (e.g. sas, hadoop, r, etc) is an assetknowledge of pharmaceutical and / or retail industries is an asset            j2wan#li-le1why work at shoppers drug mart?acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the associate-owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand.   benefit from a purchase discount program, competitive pay and online learning through sdmu.take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community.how you’ll succeed:at shoppers drug mart inc., we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture.  we believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  if that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.please note: if you have employee self service (ess) on workday, apply to this job via the workday application.

planning analyst

company:
        toronto hydro
      

location:
      toronto , on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
toronto hydro is proud to be recognized as a sustainable electricity company™ by the canadian electricity association (cea). this award is an important milestone in our sustainability journey and ensures we are mitigating the risks associated with climate change, emerging clean technologies and increasing stakeholders’ expectations. as a result, we strive to provide electricity to our customers in a way that minimizes financial and environmental risks while maximizing the benefit to society.
 
toronto hydro corporation is a holding company, which wholly-owns two subsidiaries:
 


toronto hydro-electric system limited - which distributes electricity and engages in conservation and demand management (cdm) activities; and


toronto hydro energy services inc. - which provides street lighting services.


 
the principal business of the corporation and its subsidiaries is the distribution of electricity by toronto hydro-electric system limited. toronto hydro-electric system limited owns and operates an electricity distribution system, which delivers electricity to approximately 761,000 customers located in toronto. it is the largest municipal electricity distribution company in canada and distributes approximately 19% of the electricity consumed in the province of ontario.
 
at toronto hydro, we strive to attract and retain employees through a combination of benefits, positive working conditions and a culture that values team work, results and accountability.  we are committed to accessible hiring practices. upon request, accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available. accommodation for applicants selected to participate in an assessment or selection process will also be provided, if requested.
planning analyst 
 
(insert work illustration – may need to modify for external audience):
 
key responsibilties:
 


provide assistance regarding the financial treatment of goods and services related to purchases including the associate procurement process (purchase requisitions, purchase orders.


manage the end to end administration of it contractors


assist with the processing of required governance related documentation and reporting


reporting, analytics and budgetary supports for various it portfolios


enhance and/or develop and enforce internal management control policies, guidelines, procedures and systems that will improve the overall operational effectiveness of the it governance & business solutions. this includes escalation of issues where there is evidence of non-compliance.


maintain awareness of and adhere to all toronto hydro governance processes applicable to the position


administrate the scheduling and resource utilization reporting for it program delivery resources


administrate and manage the it governance and business solutions intranet website and knowledge store


 requirements:
 
 


undergraduate degree in business administration or finance preferred, or other relevant professional designation, or combination of equivalent related training and applicable experience.


three (3) years’ experience in financial and statistical analysis.


experience in business process redesign, identification of areas for improvement and development of new initiatives.




working knowledge of toronto hydro finance and procurement process is an asset.


understanding of generally accepted accounting principles is an asset


excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills.


experience in quantitative and qualitative analysis, in addition to presenting ideas/findings in both written and oral forms


experience in managing relationships and working with individuals at all levels of an organization


anticipates future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective and is future oriented


ability to work in unstructured environments and to multi task, with good process orientation and attention to detail without losing sight of “big picture” perspective.


a proven team player with ability to work with others to achieve shared objectives and accountability


demonstrated problem solving skills and a proven proactive approach to resolving issues.


drives results and accountability: able to meet short-term needs while at the same time building a plan and process improvements for future needs


builds strong relationships:  fosters open dialogue,  builds relationships; collaboration with colleagues and stakeholders; seeks to understand problem before implementing a solution


champions change, productivity and innovation:  suggests changes and/or supports new processes which contribute to improved productivity and departmental performance


demonstrates customer focus:  able to influence, gain support and commitment from others


demonstrates commitment to environment, health and safety


develops culture and people:  demonstrates a positive learning attitude
 
to apply, please visit our careers site at

description

position at ddb canada


data analyst the analyst, marketing analytics will pair their considerable digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets.you will:guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of developmentlead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data miningensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and trainingdrive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing advanced analytics models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark datainterpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needsuse advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environmentfacilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offerscreation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualizationyou must have:curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environmentundergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline3+ years analytical experience: strong problem solving skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation/discussionstrong understanding of database design, database management, data warehousing, data mining, feature enrichment, feature engineering, variable creation, variable selectionknowledge of etl processesat least 1 year working experience on sql server and intermediate level of sql skills including sql server intergration services (ssis)knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communicationsexperience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformationkeen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadershipa strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-orientedexperience designing, executing and analyzing experiments using multi-variate testing methodologies (full-factorial and fractional-factorialexperience with developing segmentations, clustering, clv scoringintermediate level capabilities with adobe solutions, primarily adobe campaign including building technical workflows to import and extract dataproficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projectsbonus points for:experience with tableauexperience with google analyticsexperience designing, supporting, executing and interpreting research projects and experimentsexperience with digital qualitative research platformsexperience with tag management platforms (dtm, gtm, tealium iq, ensighten manage)experience with ad tech integrations for adobe analytics, domo, anametrics or google analytics premiumwe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

position description


finance analyst - toronto poultry plant

considering a career at maple leaf foods?

maple leaf foods is canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in
toronto, ontario. we make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including maple leaf®, maple leaf prime®, maple leaf natural selections®, schneiders®, schneiders country naturals® and mina™. our company employs approximately 11,000 people in its operations across canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the u.s. and asia.

our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. as we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.
 
position summary:

the financial analyst (fa) assists in coordinating the financial reporting and analysis activities in the toronto poultry operation.  this position works closely with operations to accurately reflect the results, ensure internal controls are in place and monitored, and provide finance expertise and support.
 
responsibilities:

report and provide explanations for variances/vitals weekly.
investigate variances, determine root causes, and recommend actions to minimize.
provide overhead management support to assigned budget manager and finance manager. 
data analysis.  understand cost driving activities and provide analytics to assist management.  put controls in place to minimize variances.
assist in the annual overhead budgeting process.
play a key role in the period end close process. 
coordinate period end inventory (packaging/spare parts) counts, investigate & provide explanations for variances that occur.
reconcile balance sheet accounts relating to manufacturing and ensure controls are in place, and items are accounted for.
collaborate with sr. finance analyst on special projects as assigned.
provide coverage for finance team members as required.
design, test, implement and maintain procedures.
provide leadership in formulating reports (both recurring and ad-hoc) which highlight opportunities and our progress in minimizing costs.
provide analytical support to the toronto facility.
be active and participate in six sigma projects.


education, experience & competency requirements:

post-secondary education in an accounting program
proficiency with ms office, especially excel
knowledge of sap is an asset
the ability to work cross-functionally
excellent interpersonal and communication skills
strong leadership and team building skills



we thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with maple leaf foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.  

maple leaf foods is committed to employment equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our talent attraction team at accommodations@mapleleaf.com or 905-285-5862.  reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

text:
job description - data analyst (17013396)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data analyst (17013396)job description data analyst requisition id: 17013396position type: regularposition status: full timejob: compliancework location: canada-ontario-toronto-161 bay street, 39th floorunposting date: oct 18, 2017, 5:59:00 am description   
cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution. through our three major businesses – retail and business banking, wealth management and capital markets – we provide a full range of financial products and services to 11 million individual, small business, commercial, corporate and institutional clients in canada and around the world. we invest in our businesses, our clients, our people and our communities to deliver consistent and sustainable earnings to our shareholders.  to learn more about cibc’s lines of business, please visit our website. 
 
cibc delivers access to career and development opportunities, safe and healthy workplaces, effective training, and positive work-life balance – so that employees are able to perform at their best, contribute to their communities and focus on cultivating deeper relationships with our clients.
 
every year, cibc is recognized for its business success, community commitment and employee initiatives.  we are proud of this success and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all employees can excel. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.  
 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
 
job overview 
 
reporting to the director of capital markets compliance, the position (compliance officer/ data analyst) will be responsible for conducting daily review of conduct via trading and sales activity and for identification of suspicious or unusual transactions or trading patterns or sales, which may suggest a breach of cibc’s information barrier procedures, policies or regulatory requirements. the incumbent will investigate, document and report such transactions and recommend appropriate courses of action to compliance management for consideration. the position will also be responsible for reviewing processes to identify and recommend improvements with a focus on data analytics and automation.
 
what you’ll be doing


develop or augment tools  to query data and work on database design with internal partners with an understanding of compliance mandate and financial products.
collaborate with other team members in creating efficiency by developing automation tools for manual processes.

analyze project and technical risk plans for possible short-term initiatives and recommend opportunities for enhancement, ensuring alignment with department’s goals and objectives.

apply a variety of analysis to interpret data and identify patterns.investigate, compile, document, and prepare information for regulatory inquiries using adp and smarts, and smarts data base, cognos, bloomberg, postedge, iress, ices, trs and emc records. 
conduct testing for compliance with designated umir, tse, ats and me requirements and cibc policies and procedures, escalating any non-compliance to compliance management. 
what we’re looking for 

must be highly proficient in the use of microsoft excel, access and sql querying with a minimum of 3 years of relevant technical expertise. must be able to write simple to complex macros in excel with strong knowledge of sql queries to automate multiple use of different programs. 
bachelor’s degree or equivalent in mathematics or computer science would be considered an asset.
knowledge of equity and equity derivatives trading practices and market structure issues gained at an investment dealer, regulator or marketplace would be considered an asset.
knowledge of fixed income, foreign exchange and/or derivatives trading practices gained at a financial institution or regulator would be considered an asset. 
detailed working knowledge of the activities of the capital markets division of a financial institution sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments in creative ways to day-to-day issues
working knowledge of compliance practices, procedures and principles to perform in-depth analysis of trading transactions, including non-routine and sensitive situations would be considered an asset
ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and influence assertively, clearly and concisely, both in writing and verbally
willingness to continuously upgrade skills
ability to work with many interruptions, switch gears quickly and balance competing priorities 
what cibc can offer you 

flexible health benefits, stock purchase options, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs
competitive salary and banking benefits 
career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities
opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities
click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement 
what you should know

must be legally eligible to work in canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

your technical expertise to the next level?    maintaining best in class mobility services is the wireless network operations team’s goal. we take pride in what we do, as we are all an integral part of ensuring our customers come first. this team is collaborative and supportive in sharing their technical expertise, and are looking for you - someone who embraces opportunities for continual improvement and draws from their expertise to make a meaningful impact.   position overview:   reporting to the director of wireless network operations, you will perform network assurance functions related to the telus mobility core network and provide technical guidance to other technical resources.   responsibilities:   you will take on both technical and communication roles:   subject matter expert:  provide technical guidance and act as a focal point for questions, issues and/or process clarification as requested by other technical resources represent the wireless network operations team at meetings regarding impacts, resources and scheduling conflicts; identify issues, resolve or refer to others; ensure testing has been completed and issues identified and/or escalated develop service based kpis used to measure and monitor service health and performance work in partnership with other teams to implement hardware, software, firmware, product change upgrades and commissioning of network elements/services work directly with vendors and internal departments to develop procedures and mops for new software and patches identify opportunities for improvement to technical processes and procedures; resolve or recommend solutions provision, commission, test, maintain and repair switching/data network elements and services provide trouble analysis (i.e. testing, fault isolation and repair functions using logs, alarms and operational measurements) develop preventative maintenance procedures and intervals for all areas of network equipment according to standards and/or specifications initiate discussion and/or respond to queries; provide trouble details, progress updates and confirm resolutions directly with vendors/internal teams review technical bulletins, assess impacts and communicate to other technical resources complete administrative requirements (i.e. time and expense)    collaborative communicator:  promote the sharing of information (i.e. methods, procedures, and network performance management best practices) articulate technical information to large audience with various levels of technical knowledge base, including senior leaders that may lack a deep technical understanding of internetworking technology solutions confidently represent the team and supported network elements as the technical prime during any incident management situation lead the team troubleshooting calls by pursuing multiple restoration paths and engaging multiple parties for support working knowledge of current and emerging wireless networks knowledge of network technology, architecture, transmission and power elements demonstrated knowledge of and ability to isolate and resolve troubles   qualifications required skills & abilities:   proven ability to lead within the mobile switching office groups ability to mentor others related to technical matters professional oral and written communications skills self-motivated, works well with minimal or no direct supervision ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaboratively with other departments maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment demonstrated planning and organizing skills ability to work shifts and be on-call ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks, including potentially competing/conflicting priorities and time pressures ability to both identify and resolve conflict between internal teams and external partners ability to exhibit sound and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex information with inherent confidence a bias for action and sense of urgency - the ability to not only plan and delegate, but to lead and/or take the initiative to ensure that actions and projects are on track must be able to remain calm and focused in stressful situations which includes the ability to extract information using methodical troubleshooting processes focused on service restoration leads by example of being held accountable  required knowledge:   strong tcp/ip and security protocols understanding with experience in complex troubleshooting demonstrated expertise and working experience with networking/security protocols tcp/ip, mpls, bgp, isis, ospf, ip sec, ips, ids strong knowledge of juniper & cisco routers and switches, juniper & checkpoint firewalls intermediate understanding of mobility technologies, ims, lte, umts, volte and call flows knowledge of safe work practices, safety rules and regulations able and eager to utilize knowledge and experience to assist the development of teammates through structured p2p coaching/mentoring excellent knowledge of computers, software applications and job related systems  required education:   post-secondary education in computer sciences, electronics and/or telecommunications or equivalent experience  required experience:  5 years working experience with wireless switching/data network elements experience in installation, maintenance and/or commissioning of network elements experience with packet capture and analysis products such as netscout ccnp certification red hat certification nfv – capabilities is an added advantage big data analytics working knowledge an asset  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

description

position at ddb canada


data marketing analyst the marketing analyst will pair their considerable digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets.you will:work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategyimprove profitability and drive revenue through creating effective kpis and optimization of metrics that affect themguide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of developmentlead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data miningensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and trainingdrive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark datainterpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needsuse advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environmentfacilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offerscreation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualizationyou must have:curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environmentundergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentationdeep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communicationsexperience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformationkeen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadershipa strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-orientedexperience with marketing attribution modelingdemonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including kpi development, tagging and report automation.intermediate level capabilities with adobe analytics and/or google analyticsdemonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projectsbonus points for:experience with tableauproficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)experience designing, supporting, executing and interpreting research projects and experimentsexperience with digital qualitative research platformsexperience with tag management platforms (dtm, gtm, tealium iq, ensighten manage)experience with ad tech integrations for adobe analytics, domo, anametrics or google analytics premiumwe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

sep 29, 2017
                                

 reference code: 27841-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionas part of our corporate financial planning and analytics (fp&a) team, this role acts as a finance business partner and provides proactive financial analysis and business advisory support to our business services as well as to business leaders within enabling area nationally. this position will support and report to the senior manager, and will be located at our head office in downtown toronto. the ideal candidate for this role will be a highly independent and motivated individual, who is able to work and communicate effectively across functions with strong analytical experience, customer service attitude and strong financial/accounting knowledge.
key responsibilities and areas of involvement include, but not limited to: 
- support fp&a team and enabling area fabs in any capacity required to deliver financial advisory and business support including the following:

proactively support the enabling area fabs in period-end reporting and analysis, year-end close, financial planning and forecasting, ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required
provide ongoing business insights versus plan or forecast including presentations to the leadership team on periodic financial results
provide analysis of period variances to provide insight and help drive next steps
prepare operational cost analysis encompassing variance analysis of non-client expenses
provide a future focused outlook to help to identify pending issues and identify opportunities for improvement in the delivery of this project
research, analyze and respond to ad hoc requests for financial information from within the firm
support period-end reporting activities and analysis including appropriate accruals and journal entries where required

- participate in the annual plan and quarterly forecasting process, ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required
- ongoing assessment of the operational strategy, targets, processes and policies in support of the business units’ objectives by supporting better management reporting, information flow and management and business processes

proactively look to improve operations, processes and policies to improve alignment with business plan

- participate in firm wide finance initiatives, fostering integration and collaboration across regions and services
- build relationships with finance peers supporting other services and reporting experts to share best practices and insights
external posting qualifications- education and experience

bachelor’s degree and/or a professional certification in: finance & accounting or related education
2-4 years or related years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience

- technical foundation

working knowledge of finance and accounting (debits/credits, accruals, income statements vs balance sheets vs cash flow statements etc.)
advanced excel skills: pivot tables, lookup formulas, conditionals
knowledge of ms excel, word, powerpoint, visio, financial reporting/project tracking and or database experience a plus
knowledge of sap preferred

 
·        key qualities and abilities:

ability to thrive in an environment of change
ability to adapt quickly and learn new tasks independently
accountable, responsible and responsive
excellent organization skills, able to manage competing priorities
strong attention to detail, analytical and problem solving skills
communicate effectively & tactfully with personnel on all levels
collect relevant facts quickly and provide recommendations
ability to make decisions, generate bold, creative ideas to improve processes
team oriented and works well independently
french, spanish language skills would be an asset (verbal and written)

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

job openings


data and reporting analyst
 – toronto, ontario


apply for this job




employment type
full time


minimum experience
mid-level










horizn is looking for a data and reporting analyst in toronto. 
horizn helps enterprise companies accelerate market adoption of their new products and digital technology at lightning speed.  we are in massive growth mode and are offering an amazing opportunity for highly experienced professionals to capitalize on the momentum.
 
about you
 
we are looking for a highly motivated, energetic and outgoing data and reporting analyst to service our internal and external customers.  you have a passion for unlocking the stories hidden within platform data, and are able to communicate complex concepts to business stakeholders so they can take action.
 
you are looking to join a growing, entrepreneurial team, and are seeking to further your career in the exciting field of analytics.
 
responsibilities


provide support to horizn’s customers through detailed reporting and analytics.


derive recommendations based on analysis that support key customer success objectives. 


generate ad-hoc reporting as required by the customer to support campaigns, new features, roi analysis, program health.


build best practices for reporting dashboards and communicate with internal teams to help set expectations during the customer onboarding process.


utilize analytics to benchmark customers by industry, size, location, and other metrics to provide actionable insights.


work with internal teams to provide feedback on how customers are using their programs – highlight areas to improve for future enhancements.


 
desired skills and experience:



have completed at minimum a bachelor’s degree in a relevant quantitative discipline.


2-3 years as an analyst for customer data considered an asset.


excellent knowledge and proven fluency with ms excel and data manipulation techniques (pivot tables, formulas, filters, macros, etc.)


proficient in web analytics tools such as google analytics and campaign monitor.


ability to write, modify and analyze sql code (sequel pro, mysql).


independent, highly organized and detail oriented with the ability to meet deadlines and manage expectations at different levels.

title: Senior Associate, Data Assurance & Analytics Solutions
text:
pwc canada jobs - job details












                               canada    français english       pwc home industries research and insights services private companies up front tm press room events                   ?

jobs homesearch  openingssearch  resultscurrent pagejob  details   

job details job 1 of 1   apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs      position id  11157br   title  senior associate, data assurance & analytics solutions   line of service  assurance   job type  full-time   city  on - toronto   job description  the best opportunities to let your knowledge, talent and skills flourish. our risk assurance services group (ras):pwc is continuing to grow our risk assurance practice to add even more value to our clients.  risk assurance involves much more than identifying and managing threats to our clients’ businesses - it’s about discovering where risk mitigation strategies can be converted into business opportunities.  we are looking for exceptional people to join the practice at an associate level. we are looking to find our future leaders… people who have the vision and foresight to take their career to the next level and be part of a winning team. the risk assurance services practice is currently seeking individuals to join our team based in toronto. the opportunity: senior associate - process and data assurance & analytics solutions (pdaas), risk assurance servicespwc provides industry-focused assurance, advisory and tax services within the private and public industry sectors.  the ras pdaas practice helps our clients increase confidence in their processes, controls and enhance how they manage risk by leveraging the power of data.  the four key service offerings within pdaas are process & controls advisory, audit execution, data assurance & analytics and enterprise systems & general risk control (grc) solutions.   data assurance & analytics services build and provide assurance on data accumulation, analysis & reporting engines that facilitate decision making processes for external & internal audit, risk & compliance functions, operational support and other types of data intensive projects.   enterprise systems services  provide assessments on enterprise risk planning (erp) configuration, security and role design (pre & post go-live) and grc services enable clients to manage compliance and risk more effectively using technology.  associates will be responsible for delivering multiple client engagements and engagement teams across a variety of data analytics, enterprise systems, business process controls advisory, governance and other assurance projects. candidates must have a strong commitment to providing excellence in client service and a demonstrated ability of producing high quality results. strong interpersonal skills are required to contribute in maintaining key client relationships. excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential. requirements:undergraduate degree in business, management information systems (mis) or data management fields; 3-5 years of experience successfully delivering data analytics, data assurance, erp and/or grc projects within a professional firm or internal audit/compliance function; demonstrated expertise with data analytics & transformation tools (e.g. acl, sql, tableau, qlik); demonstrated exposure to established commercial erp and/or cloud based solutions (e.g. sap, oracle, ms dynamics, workday, salesforce); excellent time management skills and ability to deliver concurrent projects; superior communication (english - oral and written) and interpersonal skills that allow you to thrive in a team environment; demonstrated ability to work in a multitasked, fast-paced and changing environment; proven organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills; commitment to providing excellent client facing service; other assets:energy, utilities, financial services, or public sector industry experience prior financial statement audit or internal audit experience travel:this position is located in toronto and candidates must be receptive to possible travel throughout canada. pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. we encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. apply for our opportunities today. this is a place that will inspire you to be at your best each and every day. your application today is tomorrow’s opportunity. pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime    apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

position summary
location:243 consumers road, toronto, ontario, m2j 4w8 canadatake ownership and find more ways to care about our local store owners in a career at shoppers drug mart central office / store support.  provide great service, specific expertise and actionable advice to support associate-owners and their staff in delivering the best health, beauty and convenience services to canadians.why this role is important?we are hiring a sr. manager, health & wellness consumer insights. reporting directly to the sr. director, pharmacy, health & wellness consumer insights, the incumbent will be responsible for enabling data, managing and developing metrics, performing analysis and recommendations in support of driving consumer insights for health & wellness business initiatives across the lcl enterprise.what you'll do:leading the effort to identify priority h&w use cases and key performance indicators (kpis) to focus data enablement & analytics capability with the health & wellness (h&w) business teams and other stakeholderscollaborate with both business and it stakeholders to develop requirements and recommendations to enhance existing systems or build new technologies and tools to enable data for h&w-related programsevangelize the use of data, analytics and consumer insights to optimize the customer journey and to influence stakeholders to further leverage customer-centric design thinking for h&w-related programsleading the development of the h&w data enablement roadmap and play a critical role in helping the organization execute on this key deliverablemanage the design and implementation of an analytical framework to respond to key strategic questions from the pharmacy and health & wellness teamsdrive a continuous improvement culture by introducing or enhancing existing analytical techniques on the team to drive more efficient, actionable and impactful business insights with the lens of the consumerleverage data sources available across the entire loyalty & consumer insights team to drive both quantitative and qualitative analysiscollaborate with data experts (internal and external resources) to build and extract appropriate and accurate data sets to support complex analyses to drive business resultsadvance departmental capabilities through mentoring, coaching, and cross-collaboration with other colleagues in the loyalty & consumer insights teamwhat you'll need:post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business, statistics, engineering, healthcare or related analytical programsgreater than five years of business analysis experience; people management / leadership experience is preferredstrong communication and presentation skills - experience explaining complex technical topics to varied audiences and adept at presenting to leadersability to set and prioritize work across the team amid competing demandshigh level of initiative to take on projects from start to finish with minimal supervision“out of the box” thinker who wants to challenge the status quo, think creatively, and drive change and innovation across the organizationexceptionally strong team player who has proven success in working within cross-functional teamsstrong ms office (excel, access, powerpoint) skills are requiredexperience with analytical tools and systems (e.g. sas, hadoop, r, etc) is an assetknowledge of pharmaceutical and / or retail industries is an asset            j2wan#li-le1why work at shoppers drug mart?acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the associate-owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand.   benefit from a purchase discount program, competitive pay and online learning through sdmu.take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community.how you’ll succeed:at shoppers drug mart inc., we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture.  we believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  if that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today. employment type:full timetype of role:regularshoppers drug mart inc. recognizes canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. we have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.please note: if you have employee self service (ess) on workday, apply to this job via the workday application.
