planning analyst

company:
        toronto hydro
      

location:
      toronto , on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
toronto hydro is proud to be recognized as a sustainable electricity company™ by the canadian electricity association (cea). this award is an important milestone in our sustainability journey and ensures we are mitigating the risks associated with climate change, emerging clean technologies and increasing stakeholders’ expectations. as a result, we strive to provide electricity to our customers in a way that minimizes financial and environmental risks while maximizing the benefit to society.
 
toronto hydro corporation is a holding company, which wholly-owns two subsidiaries:
 


toronto hydro-electric system limited - which distributes electricity and engages in conservation and demand management (cdm) activities; and


toronto hydro energy services inc. - which provides street lighting services.


 
the principal business of the corporation and its subsidiaries is the distribution of electricity by toronto hydro-electric system limited. toronto hydro-electric system limited owns and operates an electricity distribution system, which delivers electricity to approximately 761,000 customers located in toronto. it is the largest municipal electricity distribution company in canada and distributes approximately 19% of the electricity consumed in the province of ontario.
 
at toronto hydro, we strive to attract and retain employees through a combination of benefits, positive working conditions and a culture that values team work, results and accountability.  we are committed to accessible hiring practices. upon request, accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available. accommodation for applicants selected to participate in an assessment or selection process will also be provided, if requested.
planning analyst 
 
(insert work illustration – may need to modify for external audience):
 
key responsibilties:
 


provide assistance regarding the financial treatment of goods and services related to purchases including the associate procurement process (purchase requisitions, purchase orders.


manage the end to end administration of it contractors


assist with the processing of required governance related documentation and reporting


reporting, analytics and budgetary supports for various it portfolios


enhance and/or develop and enforce internal management control policies, guidelines, procedures and systems that will improve the overall operational effectiveness of the it governance & business solutions. this includes escalation of issues where there is evidence of non-compliance.


maintain awareness of and adhere to all toronto hydro governance processes applicable to the position


administrate the scheduling and resource utilization reporting for it program delivery resources


administrate and manage the it governance and business solutions intranet website and knowledge store


 requirements:
 
 


undergraduate degree in business administration or finance preferred, or other relevant professional designation, or combination of equivalent related training and applicable experience.


three (3) years’ experience in financial and statistical analysis.


experience in business process redesign, identification of areas for improvement and development of new initiatives.




working knowledge of toronto hydro finance and procurement process is an asset.


understanding of generally accepted accounting principles is an asset


excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills.


experience in quantitative and qualitative analysis, in addition to presenting ideas/findings in both written and oral forms


experience in managing relationships and working with individuals at all levels of an organization


anticipates future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective and is future oriented


ability to work in unstructured environments and to multi task, with good process orientation and attention to detail without losing sight of “big picture” perspective.


a proven team player with ability to work with others to achieve shared objectives and accountability


demonstrated problem solving skills and a proven proactive approach to resolving issues.


drives results and accountability: able to meet short-term needs while at the same time building a plan and process improvements for future needs


builds strong relationships:  fosters open dialogue,  builds relationships; collaboration with colleagues and stakeholders; seeks to understand problem before implementing a solution


champions change, productivity and innovation:  suggests changes and/or supports new processes which contribute to improved productivity and departmental performance


demonstrates customer focus:  able to influence, gain support and commitment from others


demonstrates commitment to environment, health and safety


develops culture and people:  demonstrates a positive learning attitude

description

position at ddb canada


data analyst the analyst, marketing analytics will pair their considerable digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets.you will:guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of developmentlead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data miningensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and trainingdrive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing advanced analytics models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark datainterpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needsuse advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environmentfacilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offerscreation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualizationyou must have:curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environmentundergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline3+ years analytical experience: strong problem solving skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation/discussionstrong understanding of database design, database management, data warehousing, data mining, feature enrichment, feature engineering, variable creation, variable selectionknowledge of etl processesat least 1 year working experience on sql server and intermediate level of sql skills including sql server intergration services (ssis)knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communicationsexperience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformationkeen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadershipa strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-orientedexperience designing, executing and analyzing experiments using multi-variate testing methodologies (full-factorial and fractional-factorialexperience with developing segmentations, clustering, clv scoringintermediate level capabilities with adobe solutions, primarily adobe campaign including building technical workflows to import and extract dataproficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projectsbonus points for:experience with tableauexperience with google analyticsexperience designing, supporting, executing and interpreting research projects and experimentsexperience with digital qualitative research platformsexperience with tag management platforms (dtm, gtm, tealium iq, ensighten manage)experience with ad tech integrations for adobe analytics, domo, anametrics or google analytics premiumwe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

position title: finance analyst
company: maple leaf foods
department: finance
date posted: 2017-09-28 10:37:38

location: toronto-ontario
reference no.: 9986950
emp. type: full time        


position description


finance analyst - toronto poultry plant

considering a career at maple leaf foods?

maple leaf foods is canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in
toronto, ontario. we make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including maple leaf®, maple leaf prime®, maple leaf natural selections®, schneiders®, schneiders country naturals® and mina™. our company employs approximately 11,000 people in its operations across canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the u.s. and asia.

our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. as we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.
 
position summary:

the financial analyst (fa) assists in coordinating the financial reporting and analysis activities in the toronto poultry operation.  this position works closely with operations to accurately reflect the results, ensure internal controls are in place and monitored, and provide finance expertise and support.
 
responsibilities:

report and provide explanations for variances/vitals weekly.
investigate variances, determine root causes, and recommend actions to minimize.
provide overhead management support to assigned budget manager and finance manager. 
data analysis.  understand cost driving activities and provide analytics to assist management.  put controls in place to minimize variances.
assist in the annual overhead budgeting process.
play a key role in the period end close process. 
coordinate period end inventory (packaging/spare parts) counts, investigate & provide explanations for variances that occur.
reconcile balance sheet accounts relating to manufacturing and ensure controls are in place, and items are accounted for.
collaborate with sr. finance analyst on special projects as assigned.
provide coverage for finance team members as required.
design, test, implement and maintain procedures.
provide leadership in formulating reports (both recurring and ad-hoc) which highlight opportunities and our progress in minimizing costs.
provide analytical support to the toronto facility.
be active and participate in six sigma projects.


education, experience & competency requirements:

post-secondary education in an accounting program
proficiency with ms office, especially excel
knowledge of sap is an asset
the ability to work cross-functionally
excellent interpersonal and communication skills
strong leadership and team building skills



we thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with maple leaf foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.  

maple leaf foods is committed to employment equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our talent attraction team at accommodations@mapleleaf.com or 905-285-5862.  reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

text:
job description - data analyst (17013396)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data analyst (17013396)job description data analyst requisition id: 17013396position type: regularposition status: full timejob: compliancework location: canada-ontario-toronto-161 bay street, 39th floorunposting date: oct 18, 2017, 12:59:00 am description   
cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution. through our three major businesses – retail and business banking, wealth management and capital markets – we provide a full range of financial products and services to 11 million individual, small business, commercial, corporate and institutional clients in canada and around the world. we invest in our businesses, our clients, our people and our communities to deliver consistent and sustainable earnings to our shareholders.  to learn more about cibc’s lines of business, please visit our website. 
 
cibc delivers access to career and development opportunities, safe and healthy workplaces, effective training, and positive work-life balance – so that employees are able to perform at their best, contribute to their communities and focus on cultivating deeper relationships with our clients.
 
every year, cibc is recognized for its business success, community commitment and employee initiatives.  we are proud of this success and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all employees can excel. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.  
 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
 
job overview 
 
reporting to the director of capital markets compliance, the position (compliance officer/ data analyst) will be responsible for conducting daily review of conduct via trading and sales activity and for identification of suspicious or unusual transactions or trading patterns or sales, which may suggest a breach of cibc’s information barrier procedures, policies or regulatory requirements. the incumbent will investigate, document and report such transactions and recommend appropriate courses of action to compliance management for consideration. the position will also be responsible for reviewing processes to identify and recommend improvements with a focus on data analytics and automation.
 
what you’ll be doing


develop or augment tools  to query data and work on database design with internal partners with an understanding of compliance mandate and financial products.
collaborate with other team members in creating efficiency by developing automation tools for manual processes.

analyze project and technical risk plans for possible short-term initiatives and recommend opportunities for enhancement, ensuring alignment with department’s goals and objectives.

apply a variety of analysis to interpret data and identify patterns.investigate, compile, document, and prepare information for regulatory inquiries using adp and smarts, and smarts data base, cognos, bloomberg, postedge, iress, ices, trs and emc records. 
conduct testing for compliance with designated umir, tse, ats and me requirements and cibc policies and procedures, escalating any non-compliance to compliance management. 
what we’re looking for 

must be highly proficient in the use of microsoft excel, access and sql querying with a minimum of 3 years of relevant technical expertise. must be able to write simple to complex macros in excel with strong knowledge of sql queries to automate multiple use of different programs. 
bachelor’s degree or equivalent in mathematics or computer science would be considered an asset.
knowledge of equity and equity derivatives trading practices and market structure issues gained at an investment dealer, regulator or marketplace would be considered an asset.
knowledge of fixed income, foreign exchange and/or derivatives trading practices gained at a financial institution or regulator would be considered an asset. 
detailed working knowledge of the activities of the capital markets division of a financial institution sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments in creative ways to day-to-day issues
working knowledge of compliance practices, procedures and principles to perform in-depth analysis of trading transactions, including non-routine and sensitive situations would be considered an asset
ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and influence assertively, clearly and concisely, both in writing and verbally
willingness to continuously upgrade skills
ability to work with many interruptions, switch gears quickly and balance competing priorities 
what cibc can offer you 

flexible health benefits, stock purchase options, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs
competitive salary and banking benefits 
career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities
opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities
click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement 
what you should know

must be legally eligible to work in canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

descriptioncaseware idea is seeking a customer accounts analyst to be part of our toronto team. we are a growing fintech company that sells world-class audit analytics software to financial professionals around the world. our solutions are used by over 250,000 professionals, across 130 countries and in 16 languages. to support our growth, we are looking for a customer accounts analyst that can help shape and administer our internal financial systems. in this role, the incumbent will be responsible for software license invoicing, renewals invoicing, tracking and following up with accounts receivable, license creation, crm system management and managing certification/training requests, as well as providing some administrative support to our sales, customer support and executive management teams. to thrive in this role, you must be organized, persistent, a great communicator, detail oriented and able to work independently. you must be able to produce high quality business correspondence, proofread for grammar, spelling and punctuation. in this role, you should also be able to prepare reports and documentation using office software, including email, spreadsheets and powerpoint.   key responsibilitiesfinance distributor royalty reporting and reconciliations  invoicing for new sales, monthly renewals, and project milestones payments manage, collect, and follow-up on accounts receivable analyze and report license renewals and upgrades; follow-up on non-renewals work with finance department to review and analyze aged receivables  electronic payment processing licensing software license creation, distribution, and activation process account cancellations and upgrades assist in roll-out of enhanced software licensing systems crm system managementcreation of customer accounts and account maintenance contract management general account maintenance and updates  crm reporting certification manage and address certification inquiries manage/maintain certification eligibility for qualified candidates notify distributors of certification opportunities requirements university degree, college diploma or equivalent minimum 2 years of experience as a business analyst and/or customer support representative, preferably in software or technology highly detail oriented and comfortable with financial data understanding of basic accounting principles excellent communication skills, both verbal and written persistent and confident; results driven self-directed with a strong desire to learn  exceptional time management skills and the ability to learn quickly and follow through a proven track record of solving problems must have a positive attitude and be willing to help others as required     ability to set workload priorities, take direction and request      assistance when needed   working knowledge of microsoft office (or google) programs such as      word, excel etc.  experience with microsoft crm or salesforce crm software is an      asset

loading... skip to main content sign in  languageenglish us ‎(english us)‎ career opportunities: senior financial analyst, business unit support (7121) req id 7121 - posted 09/20/2017 - full time - finance - toronto   job description print preview apply save job email job to friend return to list   home trust company is a leading canadian financial services company headquartered in downtown toronto, with offices in halifax, montreal, winnipeg, calgary and vancouver.  we are seeking talented professionals to join our thriving organization and welcome your consideration of our career opportunities.     company profile home trust is canada’s leading alternative mortgage lender, employing nearly 1,000 people in our toronto headquarters and branches across the country. our vision is to be canada’s market leader in alternative-based financial services solutions. building on the strength of our core residential mortgage lending business, the company and its affiliates also offer complementary lending services and competitive deposit investment products through oaken financial, psigate, and home bank. our culture has been shaped by the passion and integrity of our people, and we are guided by our mission and belief that every canadian deserves a home and the opportunity to prosper. home trust is a wholly-owned subsidiary of home capital group, which trades on the tsx under the symbol hcg.   through the development and maintenance of policies and procedures that comply with all ongoing financial legislative requirements, finance promotes high standards of business conduct and ethical behaviour. finance performs many complex, financial tasks ranging from administrative accounting to strategic capital management by way of analysis, forecasting and planning. the group also creates value in the business by identifying opportunities, providing critical information and analysis to make superior operational and strategic decisions, while fostering a culture of respect, trust and integrity. position overview the senior financial analyst, business unit support role focuses on the company’s various business lines, as well as leading the design and implementation of expense allocations and cost utilization. the role will require the development, documentation and implementation of cost allocations across the various business lines. the role will involve a high level of interation with the various stakeholders across the company.   the role requires the individual to establish schedules, pace priorities and offer insight through detailed analytics into the financial and operational performance of assigned business lines. strong decision making skills and an ability to prioritize multiple tasks are critical to succeeding in this role. position responsibilities business support (75%) support various internal business lines: take the lead in development of internal cost allocation methodologies for implementation across the various business lines within htc. provide detailed insight into the key drivers of each business by understanding of the behavioural nature of the business line. take the lead in development of meaningful reports that track kpis relevant for the business lines, offering valuable insight to the business related to financial impact enhance and improve existing processes to create efficiencies within the finance department, offering recommendations to management on process improvements meeting with key internal business process leads and stakeholders to gather requirement for analysis and information tracking   risk management & compliance (15%) assessment of and improvement to controls surrounding financial reporting activities, maintaining process and control documentation, adhering to all control requirements.   ad hoc (10%) special projects or other ad-hoc assignments as required. maintaining process and control documentation associated with assigned activities adhering to all control requirements formal education bachelor's degree required in business, economics or equivalent certification(s)/designation(s) preferred in related area (cfa) or related area (cpa) related experience • 3-5 years’ experience in the financial services industry • strong financial analytic skills and problem-solving skills sufficient to understand, explain, and resolve complex business issues • advanced presentation skills sufficient to convey complex concepts • solution-focused, takes initiative to work effectively and efficiently within established guidelines • strong organizational, time-management, analysis and attention to detail • strong interpersonal relationship building and listening skills • proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment • excellent written / verbal communication and professional maturity • able to multi-task and flourish in a fast-paced, deadline-driven work environment • strong knowledge of ms office, advanced excel skills; sap and cognos an asset • ability to convey financial performance to key stakeholders in a meaningful and concise way position complexities some work beyond standard hours acknowledgement all employees of home capital group inc. must comply with all applicable home capital group inc, home trust company, and specific line of business policies, standards, guidelines and controls. additionally, all employees are obligated to become familiar with home’s risk management framework and understand the operational risk management requirements within their specific business. employees are also expected to understand and comply with the company’s code of business conduct & ethics policy at all times and escalate any issues or concerns through various reporting channels (i.e. ombudsman, compliance hotline, whistleblower policy, etc).     home trust company is committed to ensuring an accessible and inclusive work environment for all persons including those with disabilities.  if you are invited to attend an interview and require an accommodation, please advise us in advance of our meeting.   agency submissions are by invitation-only and must be initiated by data scientist, data & analytics






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

date posted: 
oct 2, 2017
                                

 reference code: 24202-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptiondeloitte's marketing and sales support group is seeking a marketing manager to support the analytics offerings.  as an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for the planning and execution of a series of marketing related programs, sponsorship and events. you will also have an opportunity to work collaboratively with other internal clients to plan and execute on nationally driven programs.
 
reporting to the director, who leads the marketing efforts for high growth initiatives, this marketing manager is an energetic, ambitious individual with an aptitude for data analytics and who enjoys a fast paced, team oriented environment and strives for success and results.
 
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

assist in the development and effective implementation of marketing programs and initiatives including:
	
content development for analytics-related promotional materials (internal & client facing)
contact management programs
digital marketing
develop and maintain content for internet and intranet
speaker's programs
internal and external communications
public relations coordination
analyst relations
contact database maintenance
budget management, reporting and invoice processing
conference/event/tradeshow planning and execution
develop multi-channel marketing programs for internally developed thought-leadership to drive interest to internal stakeholders and/or external clients


ensure the tracking and reporting of roi on all major marketing activities/campaigns
ensure compliance with communication policies, procedures and brand standards
assist in the generation or identification/modification of content to support all marketing activities including; thought leadership, whitepaper, newsletter, invitations, survey material, internal and external communications
assist as requested in the creation and implementation of strategic marketing communications plans
work alongside subject matter experts to understand the business strategy and ensure marketing strategy is aligned
recommend integrated marketing communications programs and activities to achieve goals
coordinate with regional marketing professionals to facilitate the sharing of information at all levels and ensure continued coordination of plans and knowledge sharing
manage outside agencies, consultants, research vendors, and creative suppliers liaison with suppliers for promotional materials
research and respond to all internal and external information requests
prepare reports for team meeting and schedule/attend meetings as appropriate
participate in and contribute to other relevant projects
flexibility to work evenings and weekends when necessary
travel may be required

external posting qualifications
minimum of 5-7 years of marketing/communications experience, preferably in a business to business marketing communications environment and/or in the area of analytics. professional services marketing experience an asset
1-2 years of people management experience, preferably with larger cross-functional teams
bachelor's degree or diploma in marketing, communications or equivalent experience
some familiarity with the analytics marketplace
a demonstrated ability to link marketing strategy to lead generation
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, powerpoint, and outlook)
exceptional writing and verbal skills
excellent interpersonal skills and client service skills
strong attention to detail, administrative and organizational skills
event coordination experience
experience in negotiating contracts with external suppliers, vendors and associations
ability to prioritize, multi-task and perform in a deadline oriented environment
independent self-starter that possess initiative, creativity, and leadership skills
proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
self-starter, independent and proactive in identifying opportunities for new and improved services
an enthusiastic professional who thrives in a fast paced, team environment and requires minimal supervision
proven track record in working with project and budget management
willingness to learn and a positive attitude
a solid work ethic, team player and comfortable liaising effectively with partners and staff across all levels
aptitude for technology
bilingual (french and english) an asset

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Data Scientist – Customer Insights
text:
job description - data scientist – customer insights (pla03239-17)go to the main content section.skip to navigationpersonal business careers my accountsupportsearchsearch telus.comcareerswhy telus?search all jobswelcome. you are not signed in.|my profile optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagejob search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data scientist – customer insights (pla03239-17)job description data scientist – customer insights - pla03239-17description position overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

opentext - the information company as the information company, our mission at opentext is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. be part of a winning team that leads the way in enterprise information management.  the corporate operations team plays a pivotal role as part of the larger sales operations team that supports all business units at opentext, globally. specifically, this team focuses on the software tools that allow our sales and professional services teams to operate efficiently and effectively.  our core systems include salesforce.com, changepoint, and anaplan.the opportunity:the senior business analyst will report to the manager, corporate operations and will collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to implement solutions to issues that varying levels of business users face.  the senior business analyst will leverage their experience with salesforce.com to gather business requirements, implement change requests, create use cases and test plans, and provide ongoing end user support and training.  the senior business analyst will also be responsible for data management and become a subject matter experience for mergers & acquisitions as it relates to system convergence and cutovers.  lastly, the senior business analyst will support system reporting and analytics.you are great at:• gathering business requirements for all system changes and providing holistic guidance to stakeholders and it on processes that best address business needs• managing system changes through the full cycle from requirements definition through implementation and testing to end-user support and training• working with management to identify new and creative opportunities to leverage salesforce.com and changepoint to support additional business processes or functions• being a data steward and working with internal teams to audit salesforce.com data and resolving data integrity issues• partnering with internal customers to troubleshoot and solve user issues in salesforce.com• developing and maintaining custom reports and dashboards requested by the sales team and management 


what it takes:  • 3 to 5 years of experience working with salesforce.com or other crm systems; sfdc administrator certification would be a decided asset• 3 to 5 years of experience gathering business requirements; ideally having formal training in business analysis methodology and practice• 1 to 2 years of experience building use cases,  developing test plans and uat• experience working in a sales or professional services operations environment where internal customer support and success is paramount• the ability to manage several concurrent projects within a high-energy, fast-paced and continually evolving environment and the flexibility to work outside of normal business hours as needed• strong interpersonal skills, solid business acumen and a passion for technology• university degree or college diploma in a business or technical discipline. 

                            at opentext we understand and value diversity in our employees and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we hire the best talent regardless of sex, national origin, disability or race. if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com.

reference number: tbd17j-014677-003246selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962-01



	treasury board of canada secretariat
	
 	- expenditure management sector
	

























ottawa (ontario)














ec-03, ec-04





	
	




  indeterminate and determinate





	
	ec-03 salary: $63,428 to $71,769 and ec-04 salary: $68,468 to $79,234



	for further information on the organization, please visit treasury board of canada secretariat
closing date:


	
	10 october 2017 - 23:59, pacific time
	

who can apply:




 
 
persons residing in canada and canadian citizens residing abroad. 
 
 





















apply online


important messages
note that this advertisement was originally posted as selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962.only applications received directly via the system (https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/public-service-jobs.html) will be accepted. if you require accommodation for any reason, you must contact the hr advisor listed below before the closing date. if you do not clearly demonstrate how you meet all screening criteria, your application will be rejected. your application may also be rejected if it has incomplete information. we will not contact you to request information that is missing from your application
work environmentare you a data-driven problem solver with a solid foundation in math or computer science? are you intellectually curious, self-motivated, and possess strong business acumen? the treasury board of canada secretariat is looking for motivated data scientists to join a multidisciplinary team dedicated to improving transparency and openness in government reporting through the tbs infobase—a searchable online database providing financial and human resources information on government of canada operations.the successful candidate will, among other things, work to create data visualizations and new data systems, integrate existing data systems to create intelligence, use new technologies to extract more value from existing data and automate analysis which is currently done manually.the treasury board of canada secretariat (tbs) is a central agency located in the national capital region. working at tbs offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the work of a central federal agency, and to be part of cultivating the federal public service as a model workplace. with high-performing teams and innovative practices, tbs professionals in various fields serve canadians by collaborating on government-wide initiatives, driving excellence in people management and taking initiative while effectively managing risks.if you are a leader, a motivator and a strategic thinker who wants to work for one of canada’s top employers, consider joining the tbs team.
intent of the process

		anticipatory process - a pool of qualified persons resulting from this process will be created and may be used to fill similar positions with linguistic profiles (english essential, french essential, bilingual imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual imperative cbc/cbc, bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual non-imperative cbc/cbc) as well as tenures (indeterminate, deployment, acting, assignment, secondment, specified period) which may vary according to the position being staffed.this pool will be used to staff similar positions in other organizations within the core public administration (http://www.psc-cfp.gc.ca/plcy-pltq/rfli-lirf/index-eng.htm).by applying to this process, you consent to your personal application-related information being shared with other government departments interested in staffing similar positions.



positions to be filled:





number to be determined







information you must provide

  
  
    your résumé.
  

  
  

  
  

  
  
  
  

  
  

  
  

  you must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. it is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.

in order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)education:graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.candidates must always have a degree. the courses* for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. the specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.*note that the course requirement can be attained in programs such as: mathematics, computer science, data science/data analytics, accounting, demography/population studies, environmental sciences, epidemiology, geology, and/or finance.degree equivalencyexperience common to both streams:-experience in large scale* data management, validation, cleaning and categorizing as well as database development, data mining and data analysis, including recent** experience with tools such as python, r, sas, or sql.*large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.**recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.the following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)various language requirements-bilingual imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-english essential;-french essential.information on language requirementsec-03 stream:experience in any one (1) of the following: -recent** experience using programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems.ec-04 stream:-recent** experience in using programming languages (python, r, javascript, ruby, or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience in undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems. **recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.knowledge:-knowledge of programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby, sas, or sql) and techniques used to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences.abilities:-ability to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences using programming languages and related techniques;-ability to build and maintain professional relationships;-ability to communicate effectively in writing;-ability to communicate effectively orally.personal suitability:-creative thinking;-reliability; -flexibility;-initiative.the following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)asset qualificationseducation:one or more of the following:(1) a graduate or post-graduate degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial mathematics, data science, computer science, applied finance, or engineering.(2) university-level courses in any of the following: -data mining;-data warehousing;-business intelligence and data visualizations; -data analytics;-geo-spatial analysis. (3) certifications relevant to the field including:-chartered public accountant (cpa);-chartered financial analyst (cfa);-certified analytics professional (cap);-cloudera certified professional: data scientist (ccp:ds);-emc: data science associate (emcdsa).degree equivalencyexperience:-recent* experience working with the wet (web experience toolkit) and wcag 2.0 guidelines for accessibility;-experience in policy development or program delivery in an area that spans the government of canada’s responsibilities (e.g. infrastructure, it infrastructure, procurement, indigenous peoples, veterans, students, etc.);-experience working with government of canada expenditure management or people management data;-experience working with unstructured data such as text, social media, video feeds or audio;-recent* experience working in a collaborative developer/information technology (it) professional environment to automate the process of software delivery and infrastructure changes (for example dev ops);-experience working with big data including use of technologies such as distributed calculation, distributed databases, and hadoop;-experience in developing and supporting the implementation of business rules, standards, policies, guidelines or processes related to one or more of the following: data access, creation, production, storage, dissemination or evaluation of data/metadata;-working with and structuring large scale** geo-coded data for analysis and presentation;-experience working with any of the following: spss, java, perl, c/c++, hadoop, d3, shiny, tableau, and/or powerbi.*recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.**large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.organizational needs:-treasury board secretariat employees affected by workforce adjustment may be appointed before persons employed by other government organizations.-in support of achieving a diverse workforce, consideration may be given to candidates self-identifying as belonging to one of the following employment equity groups: aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and women.operational requirements: -willingness to work overtime on short notice;-willingness to travel occasionally.conditions of employmentvarious security levels: -reliability status security clearance;-secret security clearance.
other information
we will communicate with you about this process by email. as a result, you must update your public service resourcing system profile if it changes. applicants should use an email address that accepts messages from unknown senders (some email systems block such messages).if you do not respond to our communications, we will interpret this as your withdrawal from the process.candidates may be required to meet the asset qualifications or the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.reference checks will be sought.an interview will be administered.a test will be administered.please identify clearly for which position(s) you are submitting an application.you must provide proof of your education credentials.persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.you must indicate on your application if you require a technical aid for testing or an alternative method of assessment.
the public service of canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of canadian society. as a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.
the public service of canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. if contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the public service commission or the departmental official in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
preference
preference will be given to veterans and to canadian citizens, in that order.
information on the preference to veterans
we thank all those who apply. only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
contact information


ruth anne holland - hr advisor



ruthanne.holland@tbs-sct.gc.ca

title: Data Analyst, Business Analytics
text:
job description - data analyst, business analytics (adv00063)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagedigital & data open jobs|all jobs at sun life financial beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprinter-friendly version  job description - data analyst, business analytics (adv00063)job description data analyst, business analytics - adv00063 role summary:
 
this is an opportunity to join a growing business analytics team; a group of exceedingly savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are transforming business intelligence at sun life financial (slf) canada.  the business data analyst’s primary focus is supporting the plans and objectives of canadian operations by applying critical thinking and advanced statistics to find unexpected relationships and anomalies in a vast variety of data sources.  the incumbent will be responsible for supporting new initiatives, reports, enhancements and/or projects, which includes  design, development and implementation.  
 
core  responsibilities:


responsible for understanding business processes in order to research, analyze, interpret and advise on findings  and make recommendations including assessing performance and capability of processes (throughput, cycle time, productivity, waste, etc.)

identify opportunities and champion proposals for improvement (value stream analysis, business case, etc.) 

analyze data to identify root causes of client, operational, and financial issues in order to support recommendations, priorities and action plans

collaborate with business partners to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis 

develop analysis and reporting tools to support leaders' accurate and timely assessment of productivity opportunities in the method that best supports the business.  ensure analysis/toolset meets the requirements of partners and provide recommendations on the direction of the reporting toolset 

participate in the technical design, development, and testing of analysis/reports and in the creation of user documentation and processes 

responsible for maintaining and improving operational reporting including new development in accordance to best practices

proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the usability, quality and timely delivery of business reports

proficient in data investigation and compilation within multiple data sources

recommends best solutions incorporating elimination, re-allocation or simplification of data

collaborates with colleagues across the organization to achieve results
compentencies:


builds context by pushing beyond "how things are done" to understand "why" and uncover the underlying principles shaping the business

ability to extract, manipulate and simplify data through a variety of tools and techniques

draws out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources (interviews, reports, raw data, etc.)

knowledge and proficiency with sql, including the ability to build and test queries

strong analytical, problem solving, and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to produce meaningful results from data

thorough understanding of itil processes incident/change/release management methodologies

highly motivated individual who is able to learn quickly and execute independently

proven ability to work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment

strong written and oral communications skills with experience in relating complex concepts to non-technical users

positive attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to challenges

attention to detail  and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills 

expert knowledge in the ms suite of applications (excel, word, etc)

additional assets:


previous investigative experience and/or knowledge of criminal intelligence analytical methods

practical experience with microsoft sql server (ssis, ssas, ssrs)

familiarity and practical experience with dimensional data modeling and tableau

familiarity with “big data” platforms (r, python, hadoop, spark, etc) and statistical tools like matlab, mathematica, maple or sas

working knowledge of scrum development practices

knowledge of group benefits, individual insurance, disability or group retirement services products and systems
behavioral skills:


understands our business


enhances understanding about the business of slf (e.g. products and services, org structure, key competitors)

understands how his/her role relates to the business unit/ function's objectives

collaborates effectively 


drives collaboration among team members in his/ her function

presenting a supportive, united front when appropriate.

communicates confidently


communicates crisply and candidly

communicates effectively across audiences (reporting managers, peers, business partners)

balances speaking and listening to foster candid dialogue

focuses on the customer


raises concerns and recommends potential solutions for those processes that negatively impact the customer service experience or the fair treatment of customers

helps business partner understand the impact of their work on the customer/ client

organizes own work to meet agreed upon deadlines

focuses on surfacing underlying customer issues / concerns and identifying root causes

takes accountability


takes steps to understand decision making processes and procedures – uses this understanding in developing work plans

escalating issues or redirecting enquiries in a timely and efficient fashion.

following up with customers when we say we will and delivering on our commitments

works under general supervision on day to day matters.

self-starter


a confident, self-starter who can completely “own” delivery (both project and operations) and can work independently  as well as being a strong team player

adaptability


ability to adapt to changing environments

adapts or shifts priorities in response to a change in circumstances 
minimum qualification:


a university degree/post graduation, preferably in mis, computer science or mathematics

1 – 3 years of demonstrated data management and/or data analysis experience
  persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format, may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com 
*li-gm1
we thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. only those selected for an interview will be contacted.job: advanced analyticsprimary location: ca-qc-montrealemployee status: regular-full-timeunposting date: oct 11, 2017, 10:59:00 pm

text: data analytics specialist - eda platform project job - solomons international canada - edmonton, ab | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data analytics specialist - eda platform project solomons international canada - edmonton, ab contract must have'sexperience in data analysis and/or data analytics and/or data science.- 2 yearsexperience designing and constructing information products, including but not limited to data visualizations, using data analysis/analytics/bi software. (must be above and beyond spreadsheet software.) - 2 yearsexperience dealing with clients/stakeholders and explaining complex data principles in a thoughtful, more easily understood manner. - 2 yearsexcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group. - 4 yearsdescriptionoverview of services:- design and create information products / data visualizations / data dashboards / custom reports to support government decision-making and to inform the government of alberta (goa), albertans, and the general public.- provide expertise, insights, and guidance to facilitate strategic and technical planning, implementation, and usage of the analytics and visualization components of the eda platform development.general responsibilities (any or all):- design and create information products / data visualizations / data dashboards / custom reports from a variety of data sets / sources / inputs from multiple ministries, using sas visual analytics (and/or other software tools).-lead or facilitate meetings and workshops with goa departments, clients, stakeholders, and project teams. (mostly goa-internal; possibly external also.)- collaborate and contribute as part of a diverse team (staff and contractors).- examine data sets in order to draw and document conclusions about the information they contain.extract knowledge insight from data by applying various techniques and theories including but not limited to signal processing, mathematics, probability models, machine learning, computer programming, statistics, data engineering, pattern recognition and learning, visualization, uncertainty modeling, data warehousing, and high performance computing.use data analytics and data science to provide insights, support decision-making and facilitate strategic business planning across multiple ministries.provide executives and decision-makers a deeper understanding of their operations, transactions, services and information required for them to identify new opportunities that can only be uncovered through analytics.ensure delivery processes are robust, of high quality and repeatableuse statistical classification techniques such as k-means and hierarchical clustering, partition trees, and logistic regression.develop and measure success metrics / performance indicators for multiple projects/programs.provide strategic agility and the ability to make sense of large amounts of disparate data to tell a cohesive story to inform goa decision-makers, goa staff, albertans and the general public.perform and integrate quantitative and qualitative data analysis to create business insights.analyze data and prepare information results.identify, gather, analyze, and document business (or bi) requirements from several business areas. - provide analyst support for web portal projects and technology projects relevant to the eda strategy and platform, as required.capture business and technical metadata for information products.establish and operate control processes including schedule management, status reporting, issues, risk, and change management at the program level. - develop and deliver training materials.produce deliverables within specified quality standards and timelines.define and perform quality assurance on information product/visualization deliverables and other deliverables.respond to ad-hoc information inquiries.perform data analysis, data quality audits/reviews, statistical analysis, and data mining. - perform data transformations, cleansing, wrangling, joins, etc. assess data quality, deal with date formats, missing values, etc. test different approaches, if required. - perform coding with languages such as sas, python, and r. - track, analyze, and report web usage/user metrics from various web portals and websites.identify and escalate issues and risks, as appropriate.job type: contract 19 days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to solomons international canada. apply now other jobs you may like bi analyst (enterprise data analytics (eda) p... solomons international canada -
