jr. data analyst


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic data analyst. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as data analyst, you will help to deliver proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will be responsible for ensuring marketing data is set up effectively to allow insights to be uncovered for the marketing intelligence team. you’ll work though database queries, set up marketing campaigns for tracking, prepare direct mailing list files, and assist with report templates and analyses.the right candidate has a passion for analytics, is curious to learn, and is quick to pick up new skills. someone who has a strong grasp of different data types and sources and how they connect to each other. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

actively contribute to the dynamic in-house global marketing team in a collaborative and meaningful way that helps support, inspire and motivate fellow colleagues and managers alike
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
execute sql queries for ad hoc and ongoing deliverables
ensure marketing campaign data is set up effectively for reporting and analyses
ensure campaign tagging standards are effectively executed to ensure accurate reporting and analyses
manage the bulk loading of data to crm system to ensure customer data available for marketing teams
assist with the set up of integrations and automated processes for reoccurring marketing processes (stored procedures, etl, reporting etc.)
work closely with the data analyst and analytics manager to assist with set up and on-going maintenance of: kpi tracking, marketing attribution model, and standardized marketing reporting
support the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
some professional experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing
must have an understanding of relational databases 
an interest or experience in data science an asset
must be detail oriented, with strong documentation an asset
must have strong analytical and diagnostic skills
demonstrates the potential to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the potential to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication skills, combined with solid and growing presentation skills
is collaborative and demonstrates a proficiency at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, with capabilities in powerpoint and keynote
must have beginner to intermediate sql knowledge
experience with salesforce an asset
experience with business intelligence tools an asset
experience with digital analytics, social listening tools an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

data scientist






toronto, on 


job description


position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following:help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision makingvirtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques role & responsibilitiesinteract cross-functionally with a variety of teams and executives within kpmg to identify opportunities and to make business recommendations leveraging advanced analytics techniques and toolsresearch and develop analysis, forecasting, and visualization methods to improve the quality of kpmg company-wide analyticsengage with senior stakeholders across the business to advise and solve complex problemstranslate complex datasets into strategic insights for the business and communicates simply to non-technical audiences, visualizing results, to create understanding and solution buy-inidentify new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across business functionsassignments may include international projects in collaboration with our local kpmg officesminimum qualifications: ms degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., machine learning, statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering)3 years of relevant work experience in data analysis or related field. (e.g., as a statistician / data scientist / quantitative analyst).strong communication and interpersonal skillstechnical skills: proven track record of working with large structured and unstructured data sets to extract timely, meaningful and impactful insights (including writing scripts, web scraping, calling apis, etc.)fluent with database languages (e.g., sql)strong programming skills with statistical software (e.g., r, python, matlab, weka) working experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., theano, tensorflow, scikit-learn, etc.)good knowledge of data architecture / data warehousing solutionsfamiliar with data visualization tools and libraries (e.g. tableau, qlik, power bi, d3, etc.)experience with big data architectures and distributed computing is a plus (e.g., hadoop, spark, presto, etc.)#li-ak1why choose kpmg? making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at kpmg.

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - anti money laundering data analyst (1700012932)job description anti money laundering data analyst-1700012932description the aml data analyst is accountable for gathering business requirements, providing business / technical solutions, and data management support on aml projects for the enterprise aml function globally.  this role will work with different lines of business, aml compliance and technology & operations to integrate “book of records” systems, and ensure important and mandatory information are being brought in to aml for monitoring and regulatory reporting. the role will also act as an advisor to aml enterprise office to provide recommendation for system tools, and liaison with technology & operations to help implement aml technology solutions.
 
key accountabilities 

analyse data and perform data discovery to understand business operations and how aml can leverage the data for transaction monitoring and analytic. 
work with technology & operations and business operation teams to bring in book of record source systems to enhance the aml analytic work space. 
perform data management tasks include implementing data governance policies, performing data analyses, executing data quality oversight, recommending requirement for data integration, data mining, and managing meta-data documentations. 
design system process workflow and ensure workflow aligns with aml investigation processes. 
provide solution consulting services to aml partners on new initiatives. 
liaison with technology & operations team to implement technical solutions that satisfy aml business needs. 
recommend business solutions that satisfy sponsor / stakeholder needs while exploring and assessing value-add options for clients on a continuous basis. 
review requirements and technical solutions to ensure alignment with business requirement. 
evaluate requirements, determine area of system and business process impact, and provide assessment and recommendations. 
ensure adequate end user documentations and training, and facilitate small to large meeting to conduct information gathering session. 
design or provide support in creating business system testing, uat and post-implementation approach and test cases.  
coordinate with t&o and end users on post implementation testing to ensure smooth project implementation. 
.qualifications knowledge & skills 
 
process knowledge:

minimum 5 years’ experience in data analysis,  project management and business process mapping function in a fast paced environment, dealing with complex issues and managing conflicting priorities. 
strong knowledge of information technology standards, methodologies and audit requirements. 
knowledge of requirement methods including interviewing, data modeling, business process modeling and user interface design. 
knowledge of data management principles: data governance, analysis, architecture, modeling, cleansing, record management, and meta-data management. 
knowledge of software quality assurance, test case design, creation and execution. 
in-depth experience doing data analysis, data migration and data transformation. 
business knowledge:

strong knowledge of aml detection methodology. 
strong knowledge of financial services and products.
 
system knowledge:

expert in microsoft access / excel. 
expert in structured query language. (netezza, sql server, db2, or oracle) 
strong working knowledge in sas. 
experience with tibco spotfire. 
experience with etl process and technologies. 
ms office 
experience with oracle mantas and bae system netreveal is a bonus 
 
skills:

strong communication skills, both written and verbal. 
it and project management background. 
problem solving capability. 
in-depth analytic thinking. 
detailed oriented, extremely well organized, and able to manage time and expectations, and multi-task to accomplish a multitude of tasks, with conflicting priorities and timelines. 
ability to deal with clients in a professional and courteous manner, and to develop and leverage professional working relationships 
ability to deal with highly confidential and sensitive materials in an appropriate manner. 
highly organized and very proficient at administrative tasks. 
working knowledge of computer systems, pc networks and current technology. 
flexibility to changing environment
we’re here to help 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Analyst, Research & Development
text: rsa | career opportunities ­ français contact us home / career opportunities / analyst, research & development job details addthis | email favorites linkedin facebook twitter analyst, research & development position id:  j0917-0798 job type:  permanent full time job location:  toronto, ontario, canada job category:  actuarial year(s) of experience:  3+ posting date (dd/mm/yyyy):  26/09/2017 closing date (dd/mm/yyyy):  13/10/2017 keeping you moving rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. in rsa, employing positive people is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers. our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader. video: working at rsa position overview: the analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit in the pricing centre of excellence. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.about the pricing centre of excellence in canada: pricing sophistication is a key business priority for rsa and an important area of investment to empower us to be more competitive. as the industry landscape and customer expectations evolve, our objective is to be more sophisticated in our risk understanding and to be more agile in responding to changing customer needs by having deeper insights in our pricing. in order to bring rsa in line with best-in-class pricing capabilities, we recently created a pricing centre of excellence (coe) in canada and have substantially increased its resources. the pricing coe contains core personal lines pricing units, as well as a dedicated research and development unit. this is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly developing team focused on driving pricing innovation and best practices in order to make a material difference to our business. who you are your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo. you find solutions to problems. you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations. you get things done the right way. you represent our brand with passion and pride. you are a team player. you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you. what you will achieve in this role • develop new predictive models to be used for pricing and underwriting; • drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques;• design, build and maintain market-leading rating algorithms;• develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; • investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes;• contribute to the development of winning pricing strategies; and• engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results what you bring to this role • university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics; • minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience;• technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; • out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next innovation; • proven ability to turn innovative insight into implementable value-driving solutions• demonstrated success in people, project, and relationship management;• knowledge of property and casualty insurance; and• outstanding communication skills (both oral and written) other information applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with rsa or its affiliated companies (the “company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the company to the contrary.we thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.we invite you to learn more about us at our career site, www.rsagroup.ca, where you can apply on line. rsa group of companies is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities, members of the lgbt community, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.rsa group of companies will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.if you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email aoda@rsagroup.ca or call us at toll free 1 (800)-855-0511. please note this email is only for accommodation requests. resumes sent to this email address will not be considered. skills: actuarial scienceanalytical skillsassociate actuaryinsurance - property & casualtyuniversity degreeverbal job searchour processcareer levelsexperiencedstarting your careerabout avivahome







senior business analyst (finance process analytics)


position overviewthis role plays an important part in the management of aviva’s finance systems including maintenance and project initiatives to streamline operations.
this role supports the maintenance and integrity of aviva’s financial systems including the hierarchy management for financial and performance management reporting and planning, monthly account balance attestation. participate in process re-engineering that includes documenting process flows to seek opportunities for streamlining and operational efficiencies covering finance operations, reinsurance, mi reporting, expense management and robotics. recommend appropriate course of actions to streamline operations efficiency.accountabilities
recommendations of process improvements to increase operational efficiency, to remove redundant and non-valued added steps.
administer effective usage of system licenses and access management on oracle gl, essbase, drm and blackline.
conduct oracle and essbase training to users and trouble-shooting for related issues
maintain drm for new and existing segments hierarchies
monthly maintenance of financial hierarchies for both actuals and plan ( i.e. thorough analysis of new segments, security rule set up for new segments, account code identification (ccid) set up for new segments, ensure appropriate approval)
system administrator for monthly companywide blackline reconciliations ( i.e. maintenance of users, automation of reconciliations, assignment of owners to accounts, ensure business unit timely submission of reconciliation)
subject matter expert in training and servicing new and existing users on the functionality of blackline
review with frcf (financial review controls and functions) regularly on the adequacy of existing internal controls and processes
ensure tax rates in the system are accurate and up to date with current legislations
support projects to improve system operations and future system implementations or upgrades
execute monthly oracle mass allocation procedures and ensure accuracy and completeness of the executions
support the trouble shooting of allocation issues and provide feedback on queries from stakeholders
maintain the tracking and scheduling of accounting processes throughout the year
provide exemplary servicing to business partners across the organization for accounting related issues 

 required qualifications, knowledge, & skills
bachelor degree in finance, accounting, business administration / commerce and / or accounting designation (cga, cma, ca)
5+ years of experience in finance oriented roles
strong finance and accounting knowledge is required.
strong knowledge and previous system experience administering companywide account reconciliations (prefer. blackline)
previous finance shared services experience supporting enterprise accounting systems
insurance or financial services background is preferred
advanced oracle gl applications (prefer essbase, r12, and drm (data relationship management)) and microsoft applications (excel, powerpoint, and visio) knowledge
attention to detail
business acumen
problem solving
work independently and meet deadlines
strong interpersonal skills
self starter
additional informationaviva canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. if you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. applicants need to make their needs known in advance. if you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the talent acquisition partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.about avivaaviva canada is one of the leading property and casualty insurance groups in the country providing home, automobile, leisure/lifestyle and business insurance to more than three million customers. a wholly-owned subsidiary of uk-based aviva plc, the company has more than 4,000 employees focused on creating a bright and sustainable future for their customers and communities.
 
aviva canada invests in positive change through the aviva community fund, canada’s longest running online community funding competition. since its inception in 2009, the aviva community fund has awarded $7.5 million to over 250 charities and community groups nationwide. aviva canada, bringing over 300 years of good thinking and insurance solutions to canadians from coast-to-coast.
 
for more information visit avivacanada.com, the company’s blog or twitter, facebook and linkedin pages.

09/28/2017






m&a analytics senior associate, transaction services






toronto, on 


job description


kpmg llp is the canadian member firm of kpmg and has offices in 33 locations across canada. the firm's more than 700 partners and 5,600 employees provide crucial services to many of the public and private business, not-for profit, and public-sector organizations in canada.in every economic environment, there are opportunities to create, enhance, and preserve value. our deal advisory professionals help buyers, sellers, private equity investors, governments, and lenders in developing and executing on their value strategies.by their nature, major transactions such as m&a deals are higher risk and reward than day-to-day business activity. it is important for our clients to remove as much risk as possible by taking advice from experienced advisers — people who have done it before and know what to look for.we offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. we also get involved in assisting our clients with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration.our deal advisory team includes the following service lines: transaction services, valuations, corporate finance, restructuring & turnaround, and infrastructure advisory.our clients are typically private equity funds, pension funds, large public companies, as well as private corporations. our people are motivated self-starters with expertise in finance, valuation, tax, accounting and financial reporting. our network is global.  position summary kpmg's transaction services is currently looking for professionals in our downtown toronto office at the senior associate level with a focus on applying proprietary and third-party data analytics solutions in a deal environment. working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction process.   role and responsibilities the successful candidate will be responsible for:  using kpmg proprietary and third-party data analytics tools to deliver deeper insights to our clients at deal speedworking with deal teams to evaluate a business’ historical performance and sustainability of earnings/cash flows and financial projections.identifying and reporting key issues, performing the relevant financial analysis, and interpreting results.developing analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.working with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured) - investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful insights to achieve targeted outcomesconducting training and information sessions with kpmg practitioners from across the firm.participating in kpmg’s engagement teams with senior client executives, attorneys, and investors.writing detailed professional reports and other client deliverables.establishing credibility and developing relationships with current and prospective clients.providing support/assistance for proposals.contributing to the effective working of the team and development of team morale.occasionally supporting one of our other business units in a cross-functional role (e.g. valuations, corporate finance, restructuring, global infrastructure project group, etc.). at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. skills & qualifications a successful candidate will possess the following skills and behaviours:highly motivated, committed, and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.financial and commercial awareness with strong analytical skills.demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment is essential.curiosity, healthy skepticism, creativity, and attention to detail.the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.excellent verbal and written communication skills.ability to build effective working relationships internally and externally.willingness and ability to travel internationally as required. technical skills: post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business or numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, statistics, computer science.experience with databases (sql server) data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of data.prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, qlikexperience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.) is an assetproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and word#li-gr1 

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - manager data analytics & corporate intranet (1700016762)job description manager data analytics & corporate intranet-1700016762description this role’s mandate is to optimize the design and usability of bmo’s internal digital communications eco-system, with the goal of improving business performance, increasing levels of employee engagement and supporting the company’s strong culture.
 
the manager, data & analytics, corporate intranet supports the senior manager, intranet initiatives in the strategic planning, development and implementation of a digital-first program to transform the interactive platform with which  bmo engages its employees on, creating rewarding and personalized experiences.
 
in addition, the manager, data & analytics, corporate intranet will formulate a digital experience testing and tracking framework, using innovative data analytics methods and tools, to measure employee interaction and insights as well as  provide recommendations to enhance user experience, employee productivity, and adoption.  
 
key responsibilities include:
 

implementation and operations of digital analytics technologies like tag management, clickstream analytics, experience testing across multiple platforms including intranet, mobile app, etc. along with other employee data, to synthesize actionable patterns and trends, and to ensure alignment with business plan metrics and parameters.
collaborating with experience design and communication partners to establish digital performance analytics and reporting framework, including governance, kpi and metric definition.
align the timing of analysis and data collection with digital communication plans, ensure reporting maps to business objectives defined by the key stakeholders.
use analysis to develop a coherent data story with clear, easy-to-follow conclusions and recommendations to senior management and to cross-functional working teams.
conducting research to better understand employee information and knowledge needs, with a view to optimizing the digital experience and improving  access and findability of information to  unlock productivity
conduct usability testing and reviews for various design and optimization projects (a/b testing, experience usability tests, digital testing programs, etc.).
apply industry innovation in data sources, tagging, and analysis as it pertains to digital experience and knowledge optimization
act as a technical liaison between communications business and its it partners as it relates to data & analytics. 
 
 
key accountabilities
 
 
60%: data & analytics 

establish digital performance analytics & reporting framework, including governance, kpi and metric definition
data collection, analysis, dashboards and reports
analyze and critically appraise findings and develop recommendation narratives as needed.
primary lead for it related projects to collect, analyse and integrate data in operations
 
30%: user experience design, change management and adoption

conduct research to better understand employee information and knowledge needs, with a view to optimizing the digital experience and improve access to information and unlock productivity
conduct usability testing and reviews for various design and optimization projects (a/b testing, experience usability tests, digital testing programs etc.).
analyse and generate recommendations to optimize employee interaction and end user experience across bmo’s internal facing intranet and social collaboration properties and facilitate user experience change management and adoption
develop employee usage  profiles, scoring and segmentation for contextual personalization 
 
10%:  process management 

develop and maintain business process documentation, including training materials if required.
operate management controls for distribution and access to data and analytics reports and information 
assist in educating stakeholders about business processes, and help to secure adoption and effective utilization of the processes.qualifications knowledge, skills and experience:

5+ years of experience in data analytics or related field including a minimum 2 years of experience with implementation and operations of web analytics tools.
bachelor’s degree in business, mathematics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative fields is highly desirable, but not required.
solid understanding of technologies like html, json, xml, javascript, jquery, ajax, and data management and visualization tools such as spotfire, datameer, and r and demonstrable experience managing complex data sets.
must be a dynamic, detail-oriented, analytical thinker that is self-motivated, highly organized, quick learner and an impactful communicator.
demonstrable ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, subject matter experts and other cross-functional team members within a large, diverse organization.
demonstrable experience in project and change management.
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

date posted: 
sep 18, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28512-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: ottawa, ontario, canada 
all available locations: ottawa 
external posting descriptionour finance team is currently searching for bright senior consultants who are passionate about finance and technology. the ideal candidates are those who hold an accounting designation combined with a sharp analytical mind and hands-on experience in data mining, financial analysis, and performance management, plus a natural gift for communicating and presenting complex analytical findings to stakeholders and clients.
as a senior consultant within our finance team, you will: 
·        provide a comprehensive suite of services to support cfos with a focus on finance analytics, business intelligence, innovative reporting, and planning, budgeting and forecasting;
·        work with our clients’ finance executives to build their organizations’ finance analytics capacity
·        derive finance insights from unique and unstructured problems;
·        apply data mining, pattern matching, data visualization, and data modelling tools to produce analyses that help our clients with their decision making process;
·        work in a collaborative team analyzing client issues and developing solutions;
·        author presentations and present findings to clients;
·        analyze and diagnose client business issues to develop and recommend creative solutions;
·        supervise junior staff and manage parts of client engagements; and,
·        prioritize objectives and contribute to project planning and status reporting.
 
external posting qualificationsrequired qualifications:

completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials
a completed or active pursuit of an accounting designation or other relevant professional qualification
relevant experience working in management consulting or in industry in finance, financial systems, analytics and/or business intelligence
superior verbal and written communication skills

desirable skills:

knowledge of financial management and related systems and applications
experience with data mining and visualization
experience designing and implementing reporting enhancements including dashboards and visually appealing, innovative reporting solutions
advanced ms office skills including word, excel and powerpoint
experience working with sap
experience working within the public sector
bilingualism (french/english)
an mba is an asset.

canadian travel required with occasional international travel. candidates should be able to enter the usa to work on client assignments.
candidates must be able to qualify for federal government security clearance at the secret level.
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

        company description:



make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organizationwhen you invest your career in cpp investment board (cppib), you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. with current assets under management valued in excess of $300 billion, and projected to exceed half a trillion by 2030, cppib is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the canada pension plan to ensure long-term sustainability. cppib invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and currently has offices in toronto, london, hong kong, new york, são paulo, luxembourg and mumbai.cppib attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe.  join our team and look forward to:diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leadersstimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environmentaccelerated exposure and responsibilityglobal career development opportunitiesbeing motivated every day by cppib’s important social purpose and unshakable principlesa deeply rooted culture of integrity, partnership and high performanceif you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at cppib.






        position description:



the associate is part of the investment finance real estate group within the finance, analytics & risk department. responsibilities include the review of investment level reporting, setup of new investments within various internal systems, contributing to portfolio level reporting to the real estate team and involvement in complex accounting transactions.the role will partner with departments throughout the organization that impact or contribute to the governance over investment accounting and the production of various levels of internal reporting. the role will collaborate with the real estate investment team, investment governance, performance, reporting & analytics, corporate finance and other teams to ensure investment structures are appropriately accounted for, reported and disclosed in the financial statements and for performance and management reporting.the associate will be required to have a strong working knowledge of  real estate property accounting, investment accounting and international financial reporting standards (ifrs).  in addition, the role requires strong prioritization and organizational skills and the ability to work in a high performing culture, with time-sensitive deadlines.role-specific accountabilitiesassist in monthly and quarterly reporting cycles, reviewing complex investments and completing various deliverables.     review various performance related metrics, including actual returns (irrs) and benchmark data.manage relationship with corporate finance, providing support for quarterly/annual financial statement disclosure and presentation and dealing with audit inquiries on a quarterly/annual basis.participate in onboarding new investments, including system setup and developing reporting requirements with jv partners/investment teams.develop and enhance relationships with jv partners/asset managers reviewing monthly and quarterly reporting and annual audited statements.work closely with investment governance to complete legal entity accounting requirements.work closely with the investment finance real estate reporting and valuation groups to support completion of real estate specific portfolio level reporting.assist in developing and enhancing internal controls, monitoring procedures, reconciliations and reasonability checks; streamline, automate and enhance existing processes.promotes continuous improvements in processes and reporting, proactively identifying opportunities for enhancements.work cross-functionally with other team members and provide support in accounting for complex transactionsensure alignment with our vision, goals and values.






        position requirements:



as the qualified candidate you possess:university degree in business or other relevant discipline.professional designation such as a cpa, cfa.minimum of 5-7 years experience in a related role within the financial services, accounting and/or real estate investment industry.ability to analyze, apply, interpret and communicate policies, procedures and regulations effectively.skilled in investment analysis, reporting systems and computer applications.demonstrated strong communication skills (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.actively contribute to a positive and highly effective team culture.ability to adapt to change while remaining focused on strategic objectives.strong interpersonal skills; ability to foster effective working relationships internally across the organization and externally.ability to deliver in a high performance culture operating under time-sensitive deadlines.exemplifies our guiding principles of integrity, partnership and high performance.visit our linkedin career page or follow us  on linkedin. #li-ap1at cpp investment board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.we thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring processdisclaimer: cpp investment board does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by cpp investment board to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered.  cpp investment board will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

member relations, policy development position type full time region on - metro toronto area location(s) downtown toronto career level experienced (non-manager) ad online since 10/04/2017 application deadline 10/25/2017 data analyst data analyst the council of ontario universities (cou) invites applications for the position of data analyst. representing the collective interests of ontario’s publicly-assisted universities, cou (www.cou.on.ca) promotes higher education in ontario through analysis and policy development, advocacy and communications.  reporting to the senior director, policy and analysis (senior director), the data analyst conducts analysis to provide data and quantitative analysis in support of the activities and interests of cou, its affiliates, task forces, committees or the cou senior management team. responsibilities: provide research, analysis and interpretation of financial, statistical and other quantitative data.  develop and maintain databases to compile and support analysis of complex financial, statistical, and other quantitative data; compile statistical and other quantitative reports and summaries. collect required data through surveys, government sources, member engagement, and other means; determine data requirements, information flows, and appropriate analytic methods. develop quantitative models to construct scenarios and assess financial and other impacts of various policy options. contribute advice concerning data to be compiled to support analysis, and methods for the collection of data that is not readily available. lead data development projects and develops models to assess financial and other impacts of policy options. contribute to the development of and implement proposals to improve access, accuracy and relevance of data to support policy development and advocacy. provide analytical support to cou affiliates and committees, typically for projects with a significant component of quantitative information. develop, maintain and manage excellent working relationships with partners in government, member institutions, professional organizations and other stakeholders as an integral part of carrying out the above-noted duties. liaise with member institutions with respect to collection and interpretation of data, and development of databases. education and experience:  minimum bachelor’s degree, in disciplines using quantitative analytical approaches such as economics, statistics, finance, business or public administration; master’s degree preferred. at least two (2) years working experience in quantitative analysis to support policy development and/or research; recently graduating candidates may be considered. skills: superior skills in quantitative analysis, communication of quantitative information, and research required. experience using statistical software an asset (spss, sas, minitab, r, python). experience with data visualization software an asset. familiarity with the use of quantitative analysis in a policy context an asset. familiarity with the university sector an asset. other: must have excellent oral and written communication skills. must have high-level interpersonal skills, including ability to deal with tact and diplomacy with personnel in the postsecondary sector and government. must have demonstrated ability to organize and execute. ability to assume responsibility and to work independently, prioritizing and exercising sound judgement on sensitive matters. must be able to work with several projects whose goals, schedules and deadlines converge and conflict. in this environment, must meet self-imposed deadlines and demonstrate flexibility, openness to change, ability and willingness to learn continuously. those qualified are asked to submit a cover letter with resume, outlining your experience and suitability for the position as well as salary expectations, to parecruit@cou.on.ca by 5 p.m. on october 25, 2017. information regarding cou is available at www.cou.on.ca. cou is an equal opportunity employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace.  we thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. cou is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda).  if you require an accommodation during this process, please inform cou of your requirements. back to search results title: 
                        
manager, data analytics
                        










 
requisition id: 9084
the digital factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. we have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward.
do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? at the scotiabank digital factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience.
we’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
by joining our team, you will make an impact on our customers, the banking industry, and ultimately, the world.
 
about the manager, data analytics
the manager, data analytics contributes to the overall success of the applied analytics team at the digital factory in canada. you will ensure that specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed and delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. you will ensure that all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
 
you are responsible for providing reporting and insights through the use of analytical, statistical and visualization techniques.  you will work closely with internal stakeholders and data stewarts to define data elements and turn data into critical customer insights and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions within the canadian digital bank. in this role, you will require a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills, and programming knowledge to quickly draw insights from data in order to support strategies for canadian digital bank.
 
accountabilities:

you will be a champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
you will collaborate with business partners and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to develop metrics to measure initiatives and provide ongoing tracking and monitoring of performance.  prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, elements and metrics used and developed
you will develop data elements metrics and indicators to provide insights and drive business value  
you will investigate and become an expert in available data sources of data, transform and determine how they can be interpreted for analysis
you will collaborate with data scientists, data engineers and operational teams to implement quality controls and automate data feeds and report generation.
you will present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
you should understand how the bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
you will actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, aml/atf risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the operational risk management framework, regulatory compliance risk management framework, aml/atf global handbook and the guidelines for business conduct.
you will champion a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
required skills:

university education in business, computer sciences, electrical/computer/software engineering, mathematics or equivalent experience.
experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, xml, json, flat files, sas, csv)
experience with unix tools and shell scripting
solid knowledge of data analysis or manipulation tools for working with data (e.g., sql, db2, mysql, python, r)
knowledge of banking products and reporting systems are an asset (including finance systems, enterprise data warehouse and enterprise data lake)
experience using and implementing visualization tools like d3, tableau or qlikview

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto 
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. as a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, strategic analytics (1700016398)job description senior manager, strategic analytics-1700016398description the senior manager, strategic analytics (credit risk) role is an ideal opportunity to be part of a growing and dynamic team in a collaborative environment that supports personal segment of the bank. personal segment (part of p&c canada) is an important segment of the bank with 25% of the bank’s assets. the incumbent will have high visibility to senior management and will be a recognized contributor who impacts the client experience and the bank’s results. 
 
the senior manager, strategic analytics works with business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners to lead the design, development, and implementation of analytics solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and create a distinctive customer experience.  the senior manager, strategic analytics plays a key role in influencing the data architecture and data repository build for future analytical needs, providing thought leadership and insights from new data for strategies and  conducting research and analysis, generating ideas, structuring data and building predictive models and solutions.
 
this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability, providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data and analytics.  the incumbent will get to work with and support multiple lines of business to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role could also be quite attractive for a past data scientist who has performed big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of data.  the role would permit the incumbent to be engaged on both the business and technology side and will use analytics to provide additional insight to our environment and provide intelligence that will act as a catalyst of change.
 

leveraging data to drive insights and recommendation on variables that can be used to improve credit decisions 

selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using advanced modeling techniques 
data mining using state-of-the-art methods 
doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
 

building prediction models to help improve credit decisioning with objective to provide better customer experience 

creating regression based models to help improve credit decisioning 
leveraging machine learning and/or other advanced analytical techniques to improve current prediction models 
building high quality analytic solutions that are intuitive for senior audiences, simple to maintain, and drive real business outcomes
 

supporting the data infrastructure and data repository build for retail business including risk reporting and analytics 

represent the risk team for the build of data infrastructure for risk reporting and analytics. champion the process/ partner with relevant retail business stakeholders to guide the infrastructure build for retail 
extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed 
enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems across retail business 
processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
 

manages key relationships with partners to build a lasting foundation of trust and advice 

work with partners in business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners
 

contributing to building an enterprise community of data & analytics practitioners to facilitate best practice sharing and support.qualifications knowledge:

university degree in business/commerce, data sciences, engineering, finance and/or mathematics (graduate level degrees preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in analytics, finance and/or consulting. 
advanced knowledge of design and analysis methodologies to work in an agile development environment. 
experience with common data science toolkits, such as r, python, etc. . excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable. 
experience with data visualisation tools, such as spotfire, tableau etc. 
proficiency in using query languages such as sql, sas
skills:

exhibits advanced analytical, critical thinking skills, and integrative skills. 
demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level. 
demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success. 
demonstrates innovative thinking and creativity. 
is able to handle multiple priorities. 
is able to work highly independently and work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds.

we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

business intelligence and analytics manager
 
at j.d. irving, limited, you are part of an energetic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about achieving results.  with a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our diverse operating divisions.
summary of ideal candidate:

self-starter with ability to design, develop and implement a wide range of cognos solutions
work independently or as part of a team
excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong customer focus and delivery
highest education level / certifications required:

bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathmatics, operations management or a related field
minimum 5 years experience in a directly related area
extensive expertise in key toolsets (cognos, tableau, ersi gis) with a solid understanding of key bi trends
strong database understanding
experience managing large complex bi projects and teams
a solid understanding of mobile delivery architecture and best practices
responsibilities:

strategy development, building the execution plan and managing the day-to-day operations of the bi team
responsible for all operational, financial, technical and resource management responsibilities associated with:

master data management
what are they day to day responsibilities?
reporting, analytics, data exploration
bi compentency center
data preparation (sourcing, acqusision, integration)
bi governance
information delivery (portals, mobile)
advance/predictive analytics
 
to apply for this career opportunity:
 
please apply online by october 31st, 2017.
 
we appreciate your interest in our company!  the initial review of applications will happen on an on-going basis. applications received after the deadline may not be considered.  only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Analyst, Insights & Analytics
text: flipp - analyst, insights & analyticsanalyst, insights & analyticstorontodata and insightsfull-timeapply for this jobthe mission of the analyst, insights and analytics is to drive our analytics capabilities forward, empowering yourself and the rest of the team to tell data driven stories, drive action and results. flipp is looking for an analyst that's passionate about applied data analytics and excels at finding creative solutions to tough problems.as a critical part of flipp’s business in educating retailers on the endless potential of our platform you will be relied upon to further develop our methodologies and improve our existing capabilities to solve new problems and answer new questions. as an organization never satisfied by status quo we are looking for someone that will always look for ways to make us better in any way possible.impactprototype new data products and models to build better reporting and analytics productsenable external teams to tell their own data driven stories by building self-serve capabilities and educating the team on principles of data analysissupport testing and measurement initiatives to help partners understand the value flipp drives for their businesslead ad hoc investigations and data deep dives to drive decision clarity for partnersas an analyst our teams will be looking to you to generate actionable insights through the data we have collected and work with our external facing teams to take this complex data turn it into an easily accessible and simplistic presentation that will be communicated to our partners.this team has become a critical part of flipp’s business in educating retailers on demonstrating the endless potential of our platform and as a key member of this team we will be looking to you to help develop our evolving insight methodology and improve our existing methods to solve new problemsas flipp continues to grow we are always looking for ways to scale ourselves and the team.  with the growing number of requests coming from our retail partners you will be working with our business development teams empowering them to tell their own data driven stories by being able to address any routine requests which allow you and the team to tackle some of the more complex projects.communication has always be critical to success at flipp and as an analyst you will have an opportunity to influence some of the largest retailers in north america and provide them with shopper behaviour data that will allow them to be that much closer to their consumers.what you bring to the team2-5 years experience in insights and analytics with cpg or retailuniversity/college degree preferredstrong background with numerical analysis and being able to identify real insight from data using analytical methodssql and data visualization would be key. familiarity with r would be a plusyou must be able to take complex data and explain it in a simplistic and meaningful way to align with partner objectivesyou need to be a great problem solver - we like to hire people who can think through problems and develop solutions quicklyorganization and time management will be critical to your success - you need to be able to prioritize and take on several critical projects at onceyou must be able to take complex data and explain it in a simplistic and meaningful way for our partners to understand that align with their objectives you need to be a great problem solver - we like to hire people who can think through problems and develop solutions quicklyflipp corporation is an award winning technology company (2014, 2015, 2016, and 2017 best workplaces in canada award and also being awarded the 2015 deloitte's best managed companies) that is reinventing the weekly shopping experience. our digital flyer platform is used by the leading retailers across north america, including walmart and target. our mobile app, flipp, has already captured the hearts of canadians and americans alike, with millions of downloads and the honour of being named the #1 retail flyer app in canada. flipp’s culture is an integral part of what has driven the company’s success. we abide by key principles that promote the growth of others and create a high-trust environment. learn more about our team culture here: https://corp.flipp.com/culture.flipp welcomes and encourages applications from people
