with a vision to become the leading workplace compensation board, the workplace safety and insurance board (wsib) provides no-fault insurance and compensation for ontarians in the event of a workplace injury or illness.  we are committed to delivering what matters: fast, accessible service and fair benefits at a fair price.we've recently launched a comprehensive plan for modernizing and revitalizing the wsib. this is an exciting time for the organization, and we invite you to be a part of it as we work to grow and improve the services we provide. recognized as a best-in-class learning organization, we promote professional development and are committed to providing our people with opportunities to lead, learn and grow, ensuring that we're providing the best possible service to the people of ontario.  we offer a market-competitive total compensation plan and a robust wellness program that promotes a healthy lifestyle as well as work/life balance.the work we do at the wsib is meaningful and challenging and it makes a difference to the people of ontario.  we value integrity, reliability and fairness, and we embrace the diversity of the people we work with and serve. 






job summary:the claim information specialist draws upon their knowledge of data science and  health information management theory to make appropriate interpretations of the ill or injured worker’s claim information as described in relevant dictated and/or written documentation for the purpose of coding and abstracting all mandatory claim data required to:complete a claim abstract in compliance with nwisp (national work injury statistics program) standards and guidelines; support internal reporting and other strategic organizational initiatives, and; support ontario ministry of labor (mol) information requirements. as an integral part of the rdm (reference data management) team, the claims information specialist utilizes their technical, analytical and decision-making skills to communicate with different stakeholders to exchange information and serve as subject-matter expert on coding-related issues.major duties and responsibilities: 1.   coding and abstractingdiagnosis coding


		interprets and determines all relevant conditions (nature of injury) and affected part(s) of body described by the ill or injured worker, employer, health providers, and/or case managers associated with the claim being reviewed

		evaluates conditions to determine severity and appropriately assign significance using diagnosis-typing conventions

		diagnosis code selection using approved coding classification system (eg. csa-z795, icd9/icd10)

		utilization of an electronic codebook to search for appropriate codes taking into account all inclusion and exclusion criteria

		sequences codes appropriately to facilitate data submission and reporting

		assigns appropriate diagnosis categories on disease claims

		collect additional diagnosis information such as pre-existing conditions, co-morbidities, late effects, sequela and complications

injury/disease information coding


		interprets relevant source documents to determine the “event” which describes the manner in which the injury or disease was produced or inflicted by the identified “source” of injury or disease

		interprets relevant source documents to determine the “source” which identifies the object, substance, exposure or bodily motion that directly produced or inflicted the injury or disease identified under the nature of injury or disease

		utilization of an electronic codebook to search for appropriate codes taking into account all inclusion and exclusion criteria

		identifies correct accident location (standardized geographic codes) and accident place

worker information coding


		identifies primary and/or secondary occupation associated with the claim using approved occupational classification system (noc and/or soc).  selection of appropriate occupation impacts strategic planning and program reviews

		collects information on ill or injured worker’s years of experience, work start hours and work end hours

fatality coding


		identifies and collects relevant fatality-related information such as cause of death and external cause (e-code)

exposure information coding


		identifies and determines appropriate primary and secondary exposures described in the source documents

		collects exposure years

other pertinent information


		verifies and collects other relevant claim information such as cancer morphology, smoking status, smoking amount, and project id

2.   performs data quality management responsibilities


		performs data quality review on individual claim records and evaluates claim information from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness of information

		communicates with appropriate business areas whenever there are discrepancies and/or vague descriptions stated in the claim documentation

		interacts with data quality analyst(s) and/or senior business analyst(s) to discuss data quality issues and provide input on how to improve reporting and flagging of cases

		performs data reconciliation on cases that are important to reporting at the close of each month.  examples include, but are not limited to, the following:  traumatic mental stress, cancers, high impact claims, and fatality claims

		participates in data quality exercises and coding discrepancy identification and resolution

		participate in the development and implementation of departmental policies to ensure data is gathered and tracked efficiently

3.   performs case studies and chart audits


		engages in an interactive and iterative process to independently review a selected claim record and chooses appropriate diagnosis and accident information codes based on understanding of national coding standards

		participates in continuous quality improvement (cqi) at provincial and national level

4.   maintains professional expertise and credentials


		him professionals are required by chima to acquire a minimum of 36 continuing professional education (cpe) credits in a period of three years to maintain their credentials and professional standing

		cpe credits are acquired through taking him-related courses, attending seminars, conferences, workshops, and completing learning modules

5.   maintains and protects worker confidentiality at all times.6.   client engagement


		educate/support staff members from different business areas in accessing coding information in aces

		provide coding information expertise and guidance to business partners, projects and initiatives

		effectively organize and present coding information/directives to interested parties

7.   performs other related duties and responsibilities as assigned or required.job requirements:


		post secondary diploma up to three years in health information management and a canadian health information management (chima) certification

		5 years experience in healthcare-information

		5 year experience in business analytics  







 as a precondition of employment, the wsib will require a prospective candidate to undergo a criminal records name check prior to or at any time following hire. to apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date noted above. we appreciate the interest of all candidates.  due to the volumes of applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates that are selected to move forward in the recruitment process. the wsib is an equal opportunity employer.  accommodation is available under the ontario human rights code.


privacy statement

personal information will be collected from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the workplace safety and insurance act, 1997 and will be used by the talent acquisition centre and wsib hiring parties to assess/validate your qualifications and/or determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. if you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, contact the wsib privacy office, 200 front street west, toronto, on, m5v 3j1 or 416-344-5323 or 1-800-387-0750 extension 5323.  be advised that information related to application status will not be provided.

jr. data analyst


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic data analyst. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as data analyst, you will help to deliver proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will be responsible for ensuring marketing data is set up effectively to allow insights to be uncovered for the marketing intelligence team. you’ll work though database queries, set up marketing campaigns for tracking, prepare direct mailing list files, and assist with report templates and analyses.the right candidate has a passion for analytics, is curious to learn, and is quick to pick up new skills. someone who has a strong grasp of different data types and sources and how they connect to each other. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

actively contribute to the dynamic in-house global marketing team in a collaborative and meaningful way that helps support, inspire and motivate fellow colleagues and managers alike
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
execute sql queries for ad hoc and ongoing deliverables
ensure marketing campaign data is set up effectively for reporting and analyses
ensure campaign tagging standards are effectively executed to ensure accurate reporting and analyses
manage the bulk loading of data to crm system to ensure customer data available for marketing teams
assist with the set up of integrations and automated processes for reoccurring marketing processes (stored procedures, etl, reporting etc.)
work closely with the data analyst and analytics manager to assist with set up and on-going maintenance of: kpi tracking, marketing attribution model, and standardized marketing reporting
support the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
some professional experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing
must have an understanding of relational databases 
an interest or experience in data science an asset
must be detail oriented, with strong documentation an asset
must have strong analytical and diagnostic skills
demonstrates the potential to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the potential to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication skills, combined with solid and growing presentation skills
is collaborative and demonstrates a proficiency at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, with capabilities in powerpoint and keynote
must have beginner to intermediate sql knowledge
experience with salesforce an asset
experience with business intelligence tools an asset
experience with digital analytics, social listening tools an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

data scientist






toronto, on 


job description


position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following:help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision makingvirtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques role & responsibilitiesinteract cross-functionally with a variety of teams and executives within kpmg to identify opportunities and to make business recommendations leveraging advanced analytics techniques and toolsresearch and develop analysis, forecasting, and visualization methods to improve the quality of kpmg company-wide analyticsengage with senior stakeholders across the business to advise and solve complex problemstranslate complex datasets into strategic insights for the business and communicates simply to non-technical audiences, visualizing results, to create understanding and solution buy-inidentify new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across business functionsassignments may include international projects in collaboration with our local kpmg officesminimum qualifications: ms degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., machine learning, statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering)3 years of relevant work experience in data analysis or related field. (e.g., as a statistician / data scientist / quantitative analyst).strong communication and interpersonal skillstechnical skills: proven track record of working with large structured and unstructured data sets to extract timely, meaningful and impactful insights (including writing scripts, web scraping, calling apis, etc.)fluent with database languages (e.g., sql)strong programming skills with statistical software (e.g., r, python, matlab, weka) working experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., theano, tensorflow, scikit-learn, etc.)good knowledge of data architecture / data warehousing solutionsfamiliar with data visualization tools and libraries (e.g. tableau, qlik, power bi, d3, etc.)experience with big data architectures and distributed computing is a plus (e.g., hadoop, spark, presto, etc.)#li-ak1why choose kpmg? making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at kpmg.

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - anti money laundering data analyst (1700012932)job description anti money laundering data analyst-1700012932description the aml data analyst is accountable for gathering business requirements, providing business / technical solutions, and data management support on aml projects for the enterprise aml function globally.  this role will work with different lines of business, aml compliance and technology & operations to integrate “book of records” systems, and ensure important and mandatory information are being brought in to aml for monitoring and regulatory reporting. the role will also act as an advisor to aml enterprise office to provide recommendation for system tools, and liaison with technology & operations to help implement aml technology solutions.
 
key accountabilities 

analyse data and perform data discovery to understand business operations and how aml can leverage the data for transaction monitoring and analytic. 
work with technology & operations and business operation teams to bring in book of record source systems to enhance the aml analytic work space. 
perform data management tasks include implementing data governance policies, performing data analyses, executing data quality oversight, recommending requirement for data integration, data mining, and managing meta-data documentations. 
design system process workflow and ensure workflow aligns with aml investigation processes. 
provide solution consulting services to aml partners on new initiatives. 
liaison with technology & operations team to implement technical solutions that satisfy aml business needs. 
recommend business solutions that satisfy sponsor / stakeholder needs while exploring and assessing value-add options for clients on a continuous basis. 
review requirements and technical solutions to ensure alignment with business requirement. 
evaluate requirements, determine area of system and business process impact, and provide assessment and recommendations. 
ensure adequate end user documentations and training, and facilitate small to large meeting to conduct information gathering session. 
design or provide support in creating business system testing, uat and post-implementation approach and test cases.  
coordinate with t&o and end users on post implementation testing to ensure smooth project implementation. 
.qualifications knowledge & skills 
 
process knowledge:

minimum 5 years’ experience in data analysis,  project management and business process mapping function in a fast paced environment, dealing with complex issues and managing conflicting priorities. 
strong knowledge of information technology standards, methodologies and audit requirements. 
knowledge of requirement methods including interviewing, data modeling, business process modeling and user interface design. 
knowledge of data management principles: data governance, analysis, architecture, modeling, cleansing, record management, and meta-data management. 
knowledge of software quality assurance, test case design, creation and execution. 
in-depth experience doing data analysis, data migration and data transformation. 
business knowledge:

strong knowledge of aml detection methodology. 
strong knowledge of financial services and products.
 
system knowledge:

expert in microsoft access / excel. 
expert in structured query language. (netezza, sql server, db2, or oracle) 
strong working knowledge in sas. 
experience with tibco spotfire. 
experience with etl process and technologies. 
ms office 
experience with oracle mantas and bae system netreveal is a bonus 
 
skills:

strong communication skills, both written and verbal. 
it and project management background. 
problem solving capability. 
in-depth analytic thinking. 
detailed oriented, extremely well organized, and able to manage time and expectations, and multi-task to accomplish a multitude of tasks, with conflicting priorities and timelines. 
ability to deal with clients in a professional and courteous manner, and to develop and leverage professional working relationships 
ability to deal with highly confidential and sensitive materials in an appropriate manner. 
highly organized and very proficient at administrative tasks. 
working knowledge of computer systems, pc networks and current technology. 
flexibility to changing environment
we’re here to help 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

categories fundraising / giving position type contract - part time region on - metro toronto area location(s) toronto career level experienced (non-manager) salary from $22.15/hr ad online since 09/21/2017 application deadline 10/13/2017 database assistant job vacancy: database assistant location:  toronto reports to:  head of data and analytics duration of contract: 1 year (part-time - 21hrs/wk) closing date for applicants:  october 13, 2017 greenpeace canada is an independently funded, non-profit organization that works to protect the environment. we challenge government and industry to halt harmful practices by negotiating solutions, conducting scientific research, introducing clean alternatives, carrying out peaceful acts of civil disobedience and engaging the public. to maintain independence greenpeace does not accept donations from corporations or governments and is a non-profit organization, not a registered charity. greenpeace relies on individual donors and creative partnerships to fund our environmental campaigns and strive towards a green and peaceful future. greenpeace canada is seeking a database assistant to contribute to the efficiency and integration of greenpeace canada’s database solutions. under the direction of the head of data and analytics, the database assistant will play an important role in managing and maintaining the integrity and security of supporter information and providing the data, training, reporting, and insights needed to deliver effective fundraising and engagement campaigns. the ideal candidate will have a high level of it and excel literacy, previous experience with donor management and customer relations systems, strong analytical, problem solving, and customer service skills, and superior attention to detail when dealing with data. major responsibilities:   assist with data processing and reporting needs, including inputting, validating, manipulating, extracting and processing data according to data protocols; maintain and ensure the quality and integrity of data across fundraising and engagement platforms; ensure operational support within the data and analytics unit, assisting in updating business process workflows, quarterly reporting and annual audit preparation, etc.; provide reports and create and run queries as required; support the head of data and analytics in delivering training and support to internal users of the database; perform other tasks as assigned. required skills and experience: at least one year’s related work experience, ideally at a not-for-profit excellent organizational and time management skills in fast-paced environments excellent communications and customer service skills strong analytical and problem-solving skills superior attention to detail highly proficient in excel with experience in database management experience with raiser’s edge, engaging networks and/or cornerstone crm will be considered an asset a bachelor’s degree, fundraising diploma or equivalent combination of education and work experience you will work with colleagues in canada and around the world. candidates should understand and support greenpeace’s mission and campaign tactics, including the use of peaceful civil disobedience.  all candidates must be legally entitled to work in canada. greenpeace canada embraces equity and diversity and is committed to a workplace that is enriched by the people, needs and desires of canada’s diverse community. we thank all applicants, but only those invited for interviews will be contacted. title: Business Reporting / Data Analyst
text:
job application for business reporting / data analyst at intelex technologies























          apply now
        
business reporting / data analyst

        at intelex technologies
      

        toronto
      


position overview
as a business reporting / data analyst, your main responsibility is developing reports & dashboards that will be used to communicate the status of our key performance indicators (kpis) and help drive a data-driven decision making process. this role will also support special projects to analyze and report on new market opportunities. this role will report to the vp, of operational excellence but will work in partnership with the senior management teams in sales, services, finance, hr, and our product departments, and will often be called to talk or present data to the executive team/ceo. a successful candidate for this role is someone with a blend of technical skills, high business acumen, and a desire to learn all facets of a growing software company.
responsibilities and deliverables

develops reports & dashboards against our key performance indicators (kpis)
researches analytic methodologies and conducts metric reporting.
implement new tools and techniques for viewing, interpreting and communicating data and trends.
support changes/opportunities with data-driven decisions and measureable outcomes.
analyzes trends to recommend process and/or operational improvements.
prepares detail and summary level reports including written interpretation of analytic results and graphical representation.
presents results to management, including data-driven business recommendations and alternatives.
performs other duties as assigned.

organizational alignment

reports to the vp, operational excellence

qualifications
skills & work traits

the ability to understand technical aspects of software functions.
are an independent self-starter with a sense of urgency, proven results and solution-oriented.
effective communication skills and demonstrated ability to use the appropriate level of detail for the audience.
excellent problem solving skills.
ability to work with minimal supervision and is an effective team member and contributor.

technical competencies
this person should be passionate about technology, and have exposure to at least one or more of the following:

experience with relational databases.
experience with languages used for querying (e.g. sql).
experience with salesforce (or other crm).
experience with powerbi (or other report/dashboarding tools).
fluent in desktop applications (ms work, excel, outlook).

experience

experience identifying and recommending operational improvement opportunities through reporting, process and trend analysis
experience building best practices for reporting dashboards and communicate with stakeholders
work with stakeholders to develop business reviews leveraging insights from analytics, benchmarks, and best practices.

education

a degree/diploma in information management, information technology/computer science or equivalent experience.

company overview
with more than 1000 clients and one million users, intelex technologies inc. is a global leader in environmental, health, safety (ehs) and quality management software. since 1992 its scalable, web-based platform and applications have helped clients across all industries improve business performance, mitigate organization-wide risk, and ensure sustained compliance with internationally accepted standards (e.g. iso 9001, iso 14001 and ohsas 18001) and regulatory requirements. intelex is one of canada’s most highly awarded and fastest-growing tech companies and has been named one of canada’s most admired corporate culture, best managed companies in canada, one of the fastest growing companies in profit magazine, as well as one of the country’s top employers by aon hewitt and best small and medium employers. for more information, visit www.intelex.com

title: HR Analytics & Compensation Specialist
text:
career center






























new search
                       
                    


login page
                       
                    














position description











 



hr analytics & compensation specialist




location


toronto




job code


87




# of openings


1




apply now
cmls financial, one of canada’s largest mortgage lenders and technology innovators, is currently seeking a professional, energetic, and tech-savvy hr analytics & compensation specialist in either our vancouver or toronto office to provide expertise on a variety of hr programs and services, specifically concentrating on compensation, benefits and reporting.  reporting to the senior director, human resources and working closely with the hr and management teams, you will act in an advisory capacity for compensation review, analysis of market trends, managing of the semi-monthly payroll and benefits program and provide various reporting to multiple stakeholders. the hr analytics & compensation specialist will be results-oriented, accurate with a strong attention to detail and demonstrates a high degree of accountability.  it is expected that you will work with the hr team on a variety of activities, including the following: recruitment, orientation, performance management, employee relations and employee communications. 
 
our successful candidate will possess superior communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to manage their time effectively while completing high-quality work in a fast-paced environment. this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced hr professional to truly become a strategic business partner and have a tremendous impact. you will find success based on your abilities in the following areas:
50% of your time will be spent on managing compensation programs, the payroll and benefits function and reporting. working with our leaders and the hr team:


you will manage compensation, including working closely with the managed payroll provider and act as the owner of the semi-monthly salary processing, as well as employee and government inquiries.  working directly with the senior director on compensation plan design and pay-bands based on market compensation trends.


you will own the benefits function, including working closely with our benefits consultants and act as the owner of the benefit plan processing (enrollments, employee changes, and monthly reconciliations).  you will handle inquiries about benefits and acts as the hr team liaison for matters involving the finance team and the benefits consultants. 


you will complete all document management and reporting requirements for various stakeholders, including maintaining accurate, up-to-date, and complete employee records and hr information and related record systems in compliance with applicable legislation. you will complete scheduled and ad-hoc reporting and analysis related to employee data and compensation.


 
25% of your time will be spent on supporting individuals, managers and the hr team by:


supporting hr projects and other functional areas as required in accordance to the hr cycle including but not limited to establishing pay bands, supporting the teams with salary reviews, compliance and industry best practices; recommend changes and modifications to existing policies and programs to remain in compliance and adopt best practices where applicable.


becoming an innovator with great ideas for our team(s): as an hr team, work on a variety of special projects and initiatives that drive excellent people management practices, awesome company culture and mitigate risk and foster open communication.


 
25% of your time will be spent supporting the hr team: 


support process review to identify gaps, enhancements, and efficiencies for the hr team 


support hr technology implementations and modifications to drive workflows, automation, and audit controls


during hr technology implementations, the allocation to the work assignment could be as high as 50% of your time. 


 
this role is for you if:


you completed a university degree in business administration, industrial relations, commerce or psychology, with a professional designation (such as cphr considered an asset). payroll certification is an asset. 


you have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience as an hr generalist in various functions with specialization in compensation and benefits. experience in managing the processing of salaries, bonuses, commissions, and other forms of compensation.


you possess advanced technical skills using microsoft applications including office, excel, visio, sharepoint, and powerpivot which will be essential for success.


you have advanced knowledge of payroll systems, internal controls, and management including advising, recommending and implementing new hris systems.


you have experience managing projects with excellent knowledge of organization design, human resource practices and performance measurements practices.


you are exceptionally client focus and service orientated, with demonstrated leadership and the ability to establish and maintain relationships with both management and staff.


you have proven ability in collaborating and partnering with the business.


you are flexible and interested in working for a growing and fast-paced organization.


who are we?
we are canada’s mortgage company. founded in 1974, cmls financial is one of canada’s largest, independently owned mortgage services companies. we currently originate over $2.5 billion of commercial mortgages each year and since 2013, have helped over 10,000 canadians achieve their dream of homeownership.
learn more at www.cmls.ca or check out our careers page on linkedin.
 
you will love working here:
employees tell us that they love that we strike the balance in creating an incredibly professional, yet dynamic and enjoyable corporate culture. we work in a fluid and fast-paced environment that is supportive of energetic and motivated individuals who pride themselves on being flexible and results-driven. our employees get valuable industry knowledge and experience and have the opportunity to an impactful career with cmls. we are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees are what set us apart and we know it.

title: Associate Manager, Business Analytics and Insights
text:
associate manager, business analytics and insights | careers @ purdue pharma canada

careers

careers
> associate manager, business analytics and insights









associate manager, business analytics and insights





marketing

pickering , ontario


posted on:
september 27, 2017












purdue pharma canada's is investing in our pipeline which will diversify and add multiple products to our portfolio over the coming years. our portfolio diversification strategy is gaining momentum and the strong foundation we have built over the last 60 years in canada, allows us to forge ahead with bold plans for the next 60 years. 
you have an opportunity to play a key role in this success story as our:
associate manager, business analytics and insights
position summary:
 
the associate manager’s role is to be a strategic partner and provider of market information to the commercial team to help meet corporate objectives through identification of value added insights that will help impact strategy and business results. the primary objective of this position is to develop and maintain secondary market research reports, and interpret findings for current and future products. the position will be working with the other associate managers, business analytics and insights in other commercial activities such as: primary market research, forecasting, brand planning and ad-hoc requests. this role will work closely with the business development (bd) team contributing to the growth of purdue’s product portfolio through the identification, analysis and supporting the acquisition of products and technologies across therapy and disease areas of interest.
responsibilities: 

foster strong working relationships with key internal stakeholders such as sales, marketing, market access, business development and financial partners to meet project and corporate objectives as assigned 
assist in primary market research activities for current and pipeline products, including research design, vendor engagement, implementation, analysis and presentation of results 
a major portion of this role involves responsibility for assigned secondary research activities (primarily using ims and internal data) for marketed and pipeline products; this includes significant time devoted to hands-on data extraction, manipulation, analysis, interpretation and presentation 
synthesis and communication of both primary and secondary research findings into actionable insights to positively impact sales and marketing activities 
monitor marketplace and product performance trends; generate scheduled and ad hoc data reports as well as provide business analytics and strategic insights 
develop and maintain confidential data warehouses and reporting systems (e.g. dashboards) 
provide support in ad-hoc market analyses for business development and market access opportunities 
assist in the development of short and long-term sales forecasts 
provide input into marketing plans and development of corporate presentations 

qualifications: 

bachelor’s degree in business and/or science
up to 3 years of business analytics and insights experience. pharmaceutical experience preferred
thorough understanding of and expertise in modern market research methodologies
good teamwork skills, initiative and attention to detail
strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
strong project management skills are a key asset
well-developed computer skills – excel, powerpoint
experience with sas or similar computational software an assetexperience with power bi or other bi tools such as tableau or qlik is an asset


purdue pharma is an equal opportunity employer. in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005 and the ontario human rights code, purdue pharma will provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. if selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform human resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.

title: Principal Data Acquisition Specialist
text:
career opportunities











principal data acquisition specialist


location:
head office - mississauga - matheson blvd. east


department:
medical & scientific affairs



description
this is a vs 1.2 position
position purpose:
• organizes and leads the cross functional team to deliver data collection tools by fpfv for phase 1 - 4.
• sets up the data collection elements in a highly standardized manner to ensure that data collection and storage deliver the data content and quality necessary for data analysis and reporting for phase 1 - 4.
• incumbent works in close collaboration with a compound team consisting of gcl/gcpm, project data manager, project statistician, medical standards manager to develop the data collection elements and associated review activities by study team
• incumbent will  implement compound level medical standards using the available technical platforms in collaboration with the standards implementation team within ci&a (i.e., standards pim, da standards expert, compound experts in dis and stata)
• incumbent will support das standards teams in establishing and maintaining the standards library items
 
key responsibilities:
• organize and lead the development team within and outside of global data sciences & analytics (includes study manager, study medical expert, study statistician, study lead monitor and study data manager)
• develop expertise in compound requirements to ensure that all data collection requirements are identified from protocol and accounted for in the setup phase to receive data within specific compounds
• understand and ensure connectivity with collected clinical trial data from beginning to end (i.e., investigator, and patient data entry to internal data review, cleaning, and analysis by study team members)
• analyze the medical data standards and define implementation of the same for operational use within studies with appropriate details such as technical annotations, associated ecrf setup, required quality checks etc.
• develop study level specifications for data elements across platforms and ensure that they are complete and comprehensive and include programming of any study level integrations.
• setup study/library level data elements using available software including programming of edits, and derivations as required.
• complete in a timely manner all documentation for study setup  in compliance with the applicable sop and support audits and/or inspections of the same
• perform impact analysis for changes to medical data standards that are in use in studies and present implementation strategy for study teams
• create and monitor the study/library setup timelines in accordance with development sops and oms
• collaborate closely within and outside of gds&a (i.e., gcl/gcpm, project data manager, project statistician, medical standards manager) to implement compound specific requirements within studies  ensuring availability of clinical trial data soon after collection at investigator sites
• ensure setup and availability of reports and tools to facilitate data management actions
• support compound requirements training for users to ensure adherence to standards and implementation as established by compounds and cs teams
• promote knowledge sharing within and outside of das to ensure cross- platform data connectivity within studies and libraries
• maintain assigned study/library elements including making updates to elements that are in production use ensuring that all updates are fully tested before deployment
• perform other duties as assigned
 
desired qualifications:

masters with 6 years of experience
bachelors with 8 years of experience
bachelor’s/master’s degree in a natural science, statistics, computer science or a related field
experience in definition and setup of data acquisition elements in the clinical trials across different tas and phases of drug development is required
experience and knowledge of the clinical trial data management and/or data analysis process is required
experience in leading global clinical team with effective management of activities to deliver quality study level setup is required
effective time management and ability to independently manage study setup and maintenance activities is required
understanding the usage of medical data standards (i.e. sponsor specific or cdisc) in context of study is required
knowledge in routinely used technology platforms (i.e. rave, lsh, oracle clinical) for data acquisition and associated review, and reporting (i.e., jreview, spotfire) is required
experience in coaching and mentoring team members as the users of standard objects is required
understanding the principles of system design, database and edit programming is also required
experience in project management tasks and managing multiple libraries/studies as assigned is desired
exposure to industry standards on integration technology such as web services and odm.xml is desired
experience in software testing, and other verification tasks performed at each stage of the software development life cycle is desired
effective interaction and training of teams in the understanding and usage of established tools and utilities is desired
effective written and verbal communication in english and usage of microsoft office is also necessary

bayer welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. candidates participating in our selection process requiring accommodation due to a disability or medical need are encouraged to notify the bayer representative that they will be meeting with to ensure appropriate arrangements can be made.

senior analyst (1700017388)job description senior analyst-1700017388description the senior analyst reports to the manager, supplier governance within supplier governance & services team. this role is responsible to manage day to day activities to support supplier governance & services for suppliers, primarily suppliers in support of card fulfillment.  this role also acts as a key escalation point for invoicing issues in addition to activities as they relate to managing supplier relations, which includes plastics card manufacturers, paper forms manufacture, postal services, couriers and mail sortation organizations.   responsible for the effective performance and financial management of bmo suppliers and key performance indicators (kpis) are met – in other words, the incumbent is accountable for service levels delivered from the supplier, including associated costs against contracted levels of service.  the incumbent is therefore accountable for developing and maintaining a strong and effective business relationship with suppliers as well as with key internal sponsors and stakeholders as required to complete the end to end card fulfillment channel.   the senior analyst is able to apply in depth management information systems’ (mis) knowledge to ensure consistency and effectiveness of service and support, and effective management of risk and controls. this role is accountable for consolidating, forecasting and reporting of supplier costs. the senior analyst has a key role in ensuring pcs supplier governance & services office is organized, efficient and complies to supplier management, outsourcing policy and procedure requirements.  this role spans north america payments including mastercard and diners products.
 
responsibilities include having a holistic view and understanding of the interdependences of plastic card manufacturing including chip, card designs and card issuance, as well as a complete understanding of paper forms manufacturing including designs and forms options for complete delivery of fulfillment packages (inserts) to our customer.  understanding of suppliers’ equipment, technologies, processes and their capabilities. 
 
the incumbent participates and leads supplier(s) solution development relating to credit and debit card products, including non-card issuance, for the creation of new or changed deliverables varying in size and complexity.   identifies innovation opportunities to optimize and further capability across payments.  this role is accountable to introduce and sustain controls ensuring all process mapping, procedures and business documentation is current.  
 
the senior analyst is responsible to manage card carrier guidelines, updating them at a regular frequency to ensure accuracy and approve changes that impact creative design or copy layout prior to production.  partner with business stakeholders and marketing to translate strategic requirements into technical specifications, collaborate with technical resources, suppliers  to accurately scope proposed projects.  lead all new and ongoing initiatives within the card fulfillment channel.  this role works closely with stakeholders, marketing, legal and bmo partners team including support teams and technology for recommending new technologies, processes and products.
 
this role is critical in ensuring bmo customer experience is maintained through the oversight and management of inventory for onboarding and reissues (plastics & packages). oversees that sufficient inventory levels for plastics and collaterals are maintained based on historical usage and forth-coming marketing campaigns. looks for opportunities to create efficiencies and reduce costs in inventory by active management of outdated items and overstocking. in addition, the senior analyst will been involved in validation of multi-supplier invoices; as it relates to the services and products produced within the team. 



45%: operational & tactical planning (including invoice reconciliation and financial reporting)
25%  governance audit & supplier performance management
20%  relationship management
10%: special projects
 



manage metrics tracking and business performance reporting issues; escalate more complex issues to the manager, if necessary

develop and maintain high quality diagnostics for effective reporting, applying key success criteria that support the business strategy and its stakeholders

accountable for accurate management information system (mis) reporting of supplier costs to provide efficiency and effectiveness of strategic decision making

administer large and complex, linked spreadsheet data, working within prescribed time and resource constraints

analyze business performance data to produce weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual performance reports, and ad hoc reports as requested, in a concise and consistent manner, soliciting input from a number of sources both internal and external to the business unit

identify and recommend business process improvement efforts including introducing automated processes related to areas(s) of expertise, provide coaching and training to team members, as required.  

ensure all supplier management systems and tools are up to date and comply to audit requirements through monthly audit checks, confirmations

initiate and lead work effort to ensure accurate payment of all supplier invoices, ensure timely payments and manage and resolve day to day issues related to invoice, escalate more complex issues to the manager, if necessary.  verify on a monthly basis that the administrator is accurately following the process:  correct cost centers, accruals

provides financial modeling, forecast/budget analysis

support manager and business with data analysis: data modeling, data simulation, what-if analysis, scenario building

act as bmo’s representative and as the primary point of contact with suppliers, (g&d, cpi card management).  the incumbent will also participate in various monthly/quarterly committees to fulfil his/her responsibilities

t&o, p&c products, marketing, risk and fraud groups: the incumbent will interact on a daily basis with these groups to gather input, collect their feedback and monitor overall project delivery and compliance within card fulfillment channel

subject matter expert for all projects as it relates to card design, manufacturing, personalization and fulfillment

evaluates business needs to identify optimal card & package solutions

participates in the design and build of card solutions such that the downstream impacts are clearly assessed and risks are mitigated. responsible for all related documentation, updates and reporting

identifies opportunities in optimizing associated technologies; creating efficiencies and providing alternate business options

overall end to end card management accountability on the design and execution of solution

control point & oversight for card management supplier(s) architecture tools specific to bmo’s customized tables

responsible for cost analysis for solutions and impacts to run environment, conversion and project build costs

completes training sessions and/or coaches team members and business partners

acts a central point of escalation for complex issues related to card manufacturing including chip and designs, card issuance and fulfillment packages (inserts), escalate more complex issues to the manager, if necessary

interacts closely with supplier(s); strong relationship management aspect as this is a multi-supplier, multi-business group environment

monitor and review card fulfillment channel compliance to card carrier guidelines

provide information and respond to external regulatory audit requests including leading assignments for matters requiring attention

validate disaster recovery and business continuity as per bank requirements

understand regulatory and compliance requirements as prescribed for the business unit, and provide recommendations and implement actions to ensure adherence, as required

ensure appropriate framework and controls in place to  identify and address financial, reputational and compliance risks and gaps including a process for escalation to executives

project management skills in leading projects from emerging opportunities, to proof of concept, trial and implementation

identify opportunities in creating efficiencies, process improvements, technology advancements and performing baseline analysis, and execute against approved initiatives

maintain association compliance regulations and ensure we are aligned at all times for mastercard, interac, diners club international
qualifications knowledge & skills  


strong knowledge of supplier management.

strong knowledge of supply chain management.

strong understanding of financials, budgets and invoicing.

excellent analytical and problem solving skills.

experienced in using bmo ez pay, nccs, tsys docline, tsys.

strong computer literacy, with an ability to leverage technology associated with the job.

good communication skills (verbal, written). 

advanced knowledge of excel, able to build pivot tables, macros.

attention to detail and task focused.

results-oriented and self-motivated with a commitment to excellence.

solid understanding of industry practices and reporting fundamentals.

understanding of technology solutions – knowledge of tsys considered an asset. 

knowledge of nccs and ts2 card transaction systems.

bmo product knowledge.

strong conceptual skills; ability to detail with ambiguity; creativity; lateral thinker. 

ability to work with minimal supervision. 

exceptional relationship management, negotiation and interpersonal skills.

strong stakeholder management skills.

excellent project and change management skills.

strong focus on continuous improvement.

oversight level knowledge of tsys.

knowledge of the bmo technological environment an asset.

possesses minimum 3-5 years of professional experience in a financial services technology environment, experience in cards and payments is considered as an asset.
education
 


possesses a university degree or equivalent.

possesses minimum 3-5 years of professional experience in a financial services technology environment. experience in cards and payments, customer service and technology.
 
 
we’re here to help 

at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. 
 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

5+ years            
                













 



refer a friend                
















        company description:



make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organizationwhen you invest your career in cpp investment board (cppib), you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. with current assets under management valued in excess of $300 billion, and projected to exceed half a trillion by 2030, cppib is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the canada pension plan to ensure long-term sustainability. cppib invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and currently has offices in toronto, london, hong kong, new york, são paulo, luxembourg and mumbai.cppib attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe.  join our team and look forward to:diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leadersstimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environmentaccelerated exposure and responsibilityglobal career development opportunitiesbeing motivated every day by cppib’s important social purpose and unshakable principlesa deeply rooted culture of integrity, partnership and high performanceif you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at cppib.






        position description:



reporting to the manager, human resources operations and analytics, the contract senior analyst will assist with day to day administration of employee transactions, standard and ad-hoc reporting, and support related to human resources projects.key responsibilities:support the operations and analytics team with various tasks during our daily activities or specific tasks within our regular human resources cyclesassist the team in optimizing system functionality by evaluating current and desired business processes/rules and system capabilitiesidentify people, processes, and system changes required to improve processes in the context of overall workforce management and analytics needs; understand and manage the end to end flow of talent data across functionsindependently produce and deliver quarterly / monthly reports to various teams across hr and key business stakeholderssupport the management of our hr inbox by addressing functionality and configuration questions or facilitating discussions with relevant subject matter experts until issues are addressedparticipate in enhancements to our human resources systems, including support for definition of business requirements and user acceptance testing activitiesinput daily employee transactions across a variety of human resources systems as required






        position requirements:



the preferred candidate will have 5 years experience working in the human in a similar role part of an hr department.    other position requirements:strong planning and organizational skills with proven ability to manage competing prioritiesvery detail oriented with a superior track record of achieving high quality resultsgood communication skills - both written and verbalproven ability to maintain sensitive and highly confidential informationadvanced excel skills for reporting, metrics and data validationability to independently produce discrete pieces of workability to clearly define and articulate requirements, priorities, impacts, and solutionscollaborate across the organization and demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to think ‘outside the box‘ability to foster effective working relationships at all levels internally and with external partnerable to identify opportunities, take initiative and think through future implicationsprevious experience working with and reporting from hr information systemsability to work in a dynamic environment, under pressure and with time-sensitive deadlinesexemplifies our guiding principles of partnership, integrity and high performancevisit our linkedin career page or follow us  on linkedin. #li-pm1at cpp investment board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.we thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring processdisclaimer: cpp investment board does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by cpp investment board to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered.  cpp investment board will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

ingredients site map site pages slider sliderapplewood sliderweston specials store storedb stores team member story   ​​​ careers at longo's job title:  continuous improvement analyst (support centre) store location:  support centre – office   8800 huntington road, vaughan, on, l4h 3m6 date posted:  september 26, 2017response date:  october 09, 2017   ​longo’s is committed to maintaining an environment where team members have a place to grow and pursue excellence, have the latitude to take ownership of their careers and the support and encouragement necessary to be the best they can throughout their career. we are a canadian, family owned, independent food retailer which has grown and prospered since 1956. our team members are dedicated to exceeding customer expectations by offering the best food experience to every customer, every time.  it is through such commitment that longo’s now operates over 30 stores within the gta along with grocery gateway; our online grocery delivery service, is celebrating over 60 years of business and is continuing to grow.    are you passionate about providing actionable continuous improvement insights?   do you have experience as a continuous improvement professional?   would you love to pursue a career with a company that is recognized as a platinum member of canada’s 50 best managed companies and is one of canada’s 10 most admired corporate cultures?   why not join us?   position:              continuous improvement analyst   this position will play a key role in the longo’s continuous improvement department driving sales, productivity, cost management, and profitability, while addressing operational needs and delivering on the promise to exceed customer expectations. this is undertaken through the optimal utilization of tools and applications to ensure effective decision making and business function.   what you’ll do: ·         support the process change specialists with in-house and consultant-lead process improvement initiatives spanning multiple business units. ·         leverage technical skills to assess, prioritize, optimize, and determine the impacts and benefits of numerous potential ideas and implementations. ·         apply an improvement-focused mindset to determine and find any opportunities for streamlining business and operational processes. ·         provide second-opinions and engage in discussions regarding opportunities and callouts. ·         participate in cross-functional meetings and committees to report results and determine customer value impacts. ·         provide support for but not limited to erp functionality, roadnet transportation suite, scale management software, human capital management (hcm), sms, cao, ordering, shrink management, and auditing software to support the business understand of our customers’ needs and wants providing the focus needed to increase revenue and profitability. ·         liaise between it and stores/dps for supporting in-store applications and hardware. ·         conducting and reporting of ci audit scores; identification of trends and recommendations to improve/sustain ci principles. ·         performs additional responsibilities as assigned to specific role, including one or more of the following: o   analytics and coaching support for inventory management in the business units o   responsible for benchmarking business units against ci principles (5s, preferred methods and inventory management) and identify units requiring additional support and coaching o   document new processes, test applications and develop proper reporting to support initiatives o   develop business case recommendations for improving efficiency, effectiveness and service ·         support company’s strategic business plan by delivering on the operations systems objectives. ·         promote and apply safety vision “safety is our way of life”. ·         travel to multiple business units as needed.   what we are looking for: ·         post-secondary graduate, industrial/process engineering preferred ·         working knowledge of ms suite- particularly excel ·         lean six sigma certification an asset ·         strong sql and db skills an asset, but not required ·         project management skills; ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines ·         excellent written and verbal communication skills ·         strong team building skills are necessary. must be able to prioritize & collaborate ·         excellent analytical and problem solving skills ·         sound economic thinking skills with the ability to make informed and logical decisions ·         strong computer and technical trouble shooting skills   ​interested candidates are requested to click here to apply now​    home  why work at longo's  where we are located  meet our team members  message from the president  faq   longo’s is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability. note: a qualified job applicant with a disability is one who possesses the required skills, education, experience and training and who can, with reasonable accommodation, perform the essential functions of the position applied for. if you require accommodation, please contact the human resources coordinator at: telephone: 905-264-4100 email: hrdept@longos.com mail: 8800 title: Data Analytics Specialists -MH
text: data analytics specialists -mh job - oci inc. - victoria, bc | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data analytics specialists -mh oci inc. - victoria, bc contract only professionals with im, it, is and/or ict experience need apply .must be current resident of canada.location: victoria, bc.start date: oct/nov, 2017.assignment length: 6-12 months initial contract; option to extend for up to 3 years.position/project summary: we are seeking there (3) intermediate data analytics specialists who have the capacity and ability to lead, support and coordinate projects efficiently. the projects may involve multiple stakeholder groups at various levels, both internal and external to the ministry, and may range in complexity. projects may also have dependencies or linkages to other projects which may or may not be managed by the respondent to deliver. the work will be performed using data from the ministry and other health and socioeconomic databases; and business intelligence and analytics tools including, but not limited to, statistical analysis system (sas), microstrategy, and tableau; and structured query language (sql) with various direct query tools (e.g., plsql developer, toad, benthic software: golden).responsibilities/deliverables / scope of work: the intermediate data analytics specialists responsibilities / deliverables will include one or more of the following, but may not be limited to:foundational areas such as planning;data sourcing and processing;statistical processing;development of data and forecasting tools;quality assurance;report preparation and visual representation; andtechnical documentation and knowledge transfer.deliverables: the intermediate data analytics specialists will provide deliverables that may include, but are not limited to, the following:complex, cross-system, data profiling and segregation, and cohort analysis;health economics modeling (e.g., predictive, optimization, econometric, simulation modeling and hypothesis testing);forecasting, projections and time series analysis;“what if” scenario analysis;health system analysis and impact assessment (e.g., standard reporting, environmental scans, literature reviews, retrospective analysis, research, population health trending);health data, domain, or clinical subject matter expert;interactive data visualization and dashboard creation; and,methodology and definitions development and support.experience, skills and qualification: the intermediate data analytics specialists should have any of the following experience, skills and qualifications:degree, diploma or certificate in related field;minimum 3+ years experience in data analytics;minimum 7+ years experience information/data management field;experience in data and information quality management would be department: corporate services department branch: data, analytics and visualization services branch status: full-time location: newmarket / ontario date posted: october 03, 2017 date closing: october 16, 2017 number of positions: 1 progressive. collaborative. accountable. draw on your passion. shape our community. progressive and collaborative, with a clear, long-term vision. we value employees’ contributions and inspire excellence. we are driven by a desire to help shape and serve the growing community in which we live and work. position purpose reporting to the manager, partnerships and special projects, this position is responsible for supporting and leading the vision of the open data program; working with internal departments to gain access to potential datasets, catalogue metadata in the york online data access (yoda) catalogue and publish data through the open data portal for use by the broader community; engaging with the community and other municipalities across canada working on open data and visual analytics and deploying a leading edge program; reviewing, evaluating and publishing datasets to meet the corporate strategic plan key performance indicators; working with external partners to understand evolving technologies and trends in the open data movement and engage in the recommendation and procurement of new technologies to support york region’s open data vision; leading and acting as subject matter expert in the open data field to expand the footprint of users within the region by selling the ‘open’ vision to senior policy staff. qualifications • successful completion of a bachelor degree in information management, marketing/sales, or a related discipline, or approved equivalent combination of education and experience.• minimum three (3) years’ experience in information management, including experience in leading projects, concepts, practices, tools, techniques and methods to lead projects and teams.• strong project management skills are essential, particularly experience in the delivery and management of similar projects. • ability to assess existing systems and processes and provide advice and support on the most effective way to adopt new practices that meet goals and aid in transparency.• experience in managing and working with data and databases. • understanding of good metadata; understanding of spatial technologies and etl.• knowledge and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including communication, innovation, teamwork and collaboration, and personal ownership.• an effective social networker, with ability to develop and facilitate communities and communicate effectively using social media tools. • a self-starter who can work independently with minimal support but can also work in a team environment. • can recognize, create and seize opportunities to put ideas into practice. • good people management skills with the ability to develop others and to impart knowledge and experience in an accessible and clear manner. • excellent communication skills including the ability to explain data solutions and applications to business audiences.• understanding of municipal, regional and provincial operations.• computer literacy utilizing ms office software applications. • demonstrated ability to communicate insight gained through use of stories with compelling visual elements.• ability to travel to off-site locations in a timely and efficient manner, as required. • ability to work under pressure yet delivers on time with attention to detail and accuracy.• ability to work outside regular business hours, as required. scheduled hours 35 scheduled shifts 0830 - 1630 how to apply please apply on-line by october 16, 2017, quoting competition #21313. we thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. salary $45.51 - $49.45 per hour. this is a union position.                   copyright © 2017. the regional municipality of york, ontario, canada.

senior business analyst, big data
