title: Audit Data Analyst
text:
job description - audit data analyst (lon2003f)go to the main content section.welcome to myvacancies!|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - audit data analyst (lon2003f)job description audit data analyst - (lon2003f)description division
 
internal audit’s mission is to provide reasonable assurance, in an independent and objective way, on the adequacy and effectiveness of the company’s system of internal controls to support the board and senior management in reaching the corporate business objectives. internal audit adds value to the company by promoting a control culture and by providing advice to management. it reports to senior management, management committee and above. internal audit uses and is increasingly relying on data and data analytics to provide impartial and informed assessments in support of its work of providing comprehensive assurance.
 
 
role
 
the key role of an internal audit data analyst is to work with and use large data sets through various analytics techniques to derive value and insights to support internal audit’s assurance work.
 
your objective:
 work with data to generate insights and create value as part of internal audit’s assurance work


contribute to deliver the audit plan on time, within budget and quality standards

manage relationships and establish proactive interactions with auditors, business managers, it specialists and demonstrate audit’s added value contribution

lean continuous improvement: propose ideas or contribute to ad hoc initiatives to further improve the functioning and productivity of the internal audit data analytics team
 
in order to reach these objectives, you will: 


manipulate internal and external data sources and conduct data analysis in order to produce quality and actionable outputs in a timely manner

make use of data analytics, data visualization and trend reporting technics

make use of internal audit data analytics software such as sql server, tableau, idea, excel comply with internal audit standards of documentation and methodology
 
 
we offer an excellent opportunity to practice and develop your talents in a highly professional and motivated team, dealing with multi-domains and getting involved in some of the most strategic files for the company.
 
we offer a continuous professional development through: 


a comprehensive and transversal view on euroclear and its business

appropriate training per year related to the internal audit data analytics function

support to acquire external qualifications and professional certifications

opportunity to acquire detailed knowledge of other division/departments within euroclear

opportunity to help improve the processes and control culture of the company 

focus on individual coaching by your people manager  qualifications technical skills
 


you hold a university degree 

degree in statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, in a related quantitative field or equivalent expertise is a plus

you have 5 years of experience in using computer assisted audit techniques (caats), data analytics, data modelling, data visualization and data mining techniques

experience working in one of the big auditing firm is a plus

you have experience with relational databases, sql queries, data exchange formats

you possess a good knowledge of industry standards relating data analytics and data science

you understand the basics of data importation and data validation

you are very analytical and possess proven problem-solving ability, by quickly understanding and analyzing different domains 

you are able to analyse and understand business flows in order to create value with data

experience with the following software is a plus: sql server, idea, tableau, excel (advanced) vba
 
 
 
soft skills
 


you have good networking skills since you will work in close collaboration with auditors, data suppliers and business users

you stay abreast of new tools and technologies to practice up-to-date data analytic strategies

you are able to learn quickly, adjust to changes and think outside the box

you have excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to details

you are able to build relationships in a consultative style in order to understand the business of the data

you can influence and constructively challenge

you are self-confident and motivated, able to work independently and as a team member

you possess excellent written and verbal communication skills in english

the position is london , brussels or paris based and for a full time schedule. you are flexible, when travelling is required between these locations.
 
 
euroclear recruits people from all walks of life. our 3,500 employees represent 89 nationalities, of which over 50% are women. we are deeply convinced that diversity of talents, backgrounds and opinions is a key to success, by fostering engagement, energy and innovation. we are committed to promoting diversity within the organisation, as well as an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves, feels valued and respected, regardless of their background.
 
  primary location: brussels officeother locations: london office, paris officearea of interest: audit

 reference code: 28626-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: kitchener; montreal; ottawa; toronto; vancouver 
external posting descriptionwe are looking for a technical lead for digital marketing, in our oracle marketing cloud team.
the senior consultant at deloitte works within an engagement team and is responsible for driving to a plan and with a team. the role requires liaising with the senior leadership (client and deloitte), and implementing core martech technologies for clients. in this role you will be responsible for working on consultative engagements to develops, implement, and optimize multiple digital channels campaigns and initiatives including web, mobile, email, social media, consumer relationship marketing, search engine optimization, search engine marketing and digital advertising. being the senior technical resource responsible you will be responsible for architecture and configuration of the marketing technology solution and will act as liaison between the business and technical requirements.
you’ll help organizations improve marketing and customer processes, optimize their data and approach to communications and analytics, and create personalized experiences… the cool stuff in digital marketing. ideal candidates will have experience with marketing cloud and complementary products, leveraging crm systems experience and integration best practices (salesforce, oracle cx, microsoft dynamics), experience with custom and 3rd party integrations, launching audience segmentation and lead scoring programs, and hold expertise in marketing orchestration, automation, data modeling and apis.

roles & responsibilities include: 

technical lead in implementation projects of oracle marketing cloud solutions
run and lead discovery workshops, create user stories, work with product back-log, and ensure clients get high-value implementations
liaise between technical and business domains, ensuring all parties are on the same page, on-board and that all potential pitfalls are covered
work closely with clients to design and execute automated customer journeys, campaigns and nurture programs
develop and execute social media campaigns (facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc.)
be at the fore-front of technology and stay up-to-date with the latest tech and news
work with clients to design and implement actionable measurement tools and kpis - conversion, retention, acquisition costs, etc.
perform demand generation/outsourced marketing tasks on behalf of clients including creation of email/landing pages/templates and web form templates
apply analytics to continually improve demand generation
position yourself as trusted advisor with our clients by showing great ethics, experience and the use of best practice

external posting qualificationsrequired:

strong expertise in marketing automation with several successful projects, performing actual implementations
experience defining marketing strategy and developing and implementing customer journeys and multi-step campaigns
experience designing and implementing lead score models and lead generation program
functional knowledge of digital demand generation, content marketing, social media marketing and email marketing
advanced knowledge of cloud connectors and third party application use and capabilities
reporting and analysis - experienced defining, measuring and reporting on customer engagement metrics and marketing return on investment (roi)
ability to travel to client sites 75-100% of the time.

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: 
                        
sr. manager, global hiring & onboarding experience
                        









 

requisition id: 8225
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
reporting to the vp, global recruitment, this leadership role is accountable for the development and execution of an awesome candidate hiring experience.  this role identifies potential tools/solutions to enhance an efficient recruitment process, works with program owners to make changes to the existing process and supports the roll-out of a new global recruitment platform to over 50 countries.  additionally, this role measures and reports on the overall effectiveness of the hiring process.
 
this role leads a team of recruitment professionals that are passionate about delivering an excellent experience to all stakeholders in the hiring process.  we have an award winning hiring process and we are looking to make it even better.
 
accountabilities:

develop a global candidate experience strategy; identifying moments of truth, gaps in current process and opportunities for improvement
lead the continuous improvement of a new global hiring process that is currently being implemented across 50+ countries; driving maximum efficiency.
partner with the recruitment technology lead on ongoing global roll-out of successfactors recruitment ensuring alignment of new process and tools to the candidate experience strategy.
identify, develop and implement tool solutions that will continue to enhance the hiring experience for candidates and hiring managers.
optimize current recruitment tools and relationships with third parties to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the hiring process.
lead the development of key metrics to measure the success and efficiency of the new candidate hiring and onboarding experience including leading our candee award initiative.
develop ongoing relationships with global recruitment teams, hr services and other relevant parties to execute processes and maintain recruitment technologies and tools
ensure recruitment processes, policies and tools are aligned with the overall talent strategy and in compliance with regulatory requirements.
provide thought leadership on all aspects of recruitment operations to drive effective usage of tools and program delivery.  recommending innovative and progressive solutions to enhance overall experience.
build a high performing and inclusive team; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
required skills and experience

demonstrated thought-leadership in the identification, development and implementation of leading edge recruitment solutions and tools for a global organization.


deep subject matter and technical recruitment expertise to support a global recruitment team, business hr and other internal stakeholders globally.
strong people leader that is excellent at setting goals, providing feedback and coaching a high performing team.
ability to leverage data from multiple sources to analyze and understand business trends as well as use analytics and insights to influence change.
strong skills in research, writing, editing and project management
fluent spanish, french ideal, but not essential

 
education / experience / other information 

post-secondary degree in human resources or business or related field
3-5 year of previous experience in a global recruitment team required 
demonstrated expertise of global recruitment processes and programs
excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
strong change management and influencing skills
ability to understand organizational needs and develop solutions
ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

title: Energy Data Scientist
text: energy data scientist job - energy profiles limited - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province energy data scientist energy profiles limited - toronto, on about eplat epl, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.we help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.at epl, we combine cloud-based software/analytics with a deep understanding of how buildings use energy to help our clients drive energy savings and reduce their greenhouse gas (ghg) emissions.at the same time, we help our clients manage the complexities of all types of data from utility bills, energy meters, building automation systems, and weather stations (to name a few). we leverage this data to provide trusted and insightful analytics, reporting, forecasting, and planning guidance with respect to both environmental impacts and costs.we develop energy management software. but we know that software doesn’t save energy; software built and continuously improved by smart, motivated people helps our clients – also smart, motivated people - to make good decisions.about the roleenergy data scientists are an integral part of our data systems group. this is our team of engineers, analysts, and developers who both develop and utilize our proprietary software and systems to analyze and report on utility data. as a member of the team you will:apply your expertise to a range of client projects and create meaningful outcomes.create models to analyze how energy consumption at buildings corresponds to weather.load and validate utility data – making it trusted - from various digital sources.prepare monthly and annual energy consumption and cost forecasts based on historical usage and projected utility rates and weather.prepare ghg emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.analyze, identify and quantify changes to energy consumption at properties.about youyou are smart and act with purpose. you want to be a part of building our team and company.nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, or another technical field (or equivalent experience).microsoft sql experience is considered an asset. (hint: can you write a join statement?)you demonstrate advanced proficiency in microsoft excel. (hint: can you do an index and match ?)what to expectpeople are the most important part of our company.we have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. the success of our people drives the success of our company.to that end, energy data scientists typically complete several rotations in their first year at epl. each rotation involves doing real work on a different aspect of our business. potential rotations include:building analytics: how is energy used in buildings? where are the opportunities for savings?data science: what are the 5,000 pieces of energy data generated by a skyscraper every day? is the data accurate? what does it tell us?web development: how do we best present information to our clients to drive savings?data integrity: do you know what each line item on your electricity bill means? how do you know if you were billed correctly?forecasting and reporting: what insights do our clients need to help run their businesses?each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.epl team members also:take unlimited vacationenjoy flexible work hours (our office has time zones!)work with a dynamic team of like-minded people and clientsparticipate in sponsored social events throughout the yearjob type: full-timejob location:toronto, onrequired education:bachelor'srequired language:english 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to energy profiles limited. apply now other jobs you may like data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 5 hours ago data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 1 day ago easily apply data scientist jla recruiting - toronto, on 9 days ago easily apply senior data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 5 hours ago data scientist canadian tire: corporate - toronto, on canadian tire -  12 days ago »see more recommended jobs - 4 new followget job updates from energy profiles limited. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. energy profiles limited energy profiles limited (epl) is a full service energy software services and engineering firm focused on driving down energy and water use... about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior functional testing analyst (1700017617)job description senior functional testing analyst-1700017617description the senior functional testing quality assurance analyst (sftqaa) is accountable to provide project planning, administration, and leadership in the testing of information technology (it) products. these activities may include interacting and negotiating with other development groups and/or external entities. in addition, the sftqaa may document and create test cases for highly complex functions and execute and verify those test cases as part of the overall functional testing of it products. in performing this job, the sftqaa follows the functional testing processes and procedures set out at the enterprise and/or development group level. the sftqaa provides input on the effectiveness and efficiency of these processes and procedures and, when appropriate, recommends improvement.
 

accountabilities

participates in process improvement initiatives by providing feedback on deployed processes and helping with the piloting and training on software development methodologies in order to optimize those processes and methodologies 
writes new test packages and updates existing test packages (i.e., design, execution plan, and data preparation) in order to correctly guide subsequent testing activities 
moderates reviews or inspections of the project team to ensure the quality of work products 
executes and verifies the performance of medium to high complexity system functions in order to demonstrate the integrity of those functions 
creates supporting documentation and administrative reports (e.g., work orders and timesheets) to facilitate the proper monitoring and control of project progress 
reviews and interprets all documentation related to testing, including business requirements and functional and design specifications, in order to provide input to the project team regarding the planning of testing activities 
performs the following functional testing planning activities, for projects of medium to high complexity: test strategy (including test level assessment), costing, budget, timeline, resourcing (in collaboration with the resource manager), scheduling, distribution of work, distribution of new and regression test packages, and sign-off, to ensure an effective and efficient testing approach 
chairs work order/exposure meetings and gathers information from the project team in order to prioritize and schedule the correction and delivery of defects found during testing 
records and reports statistical data relevant to the functional testing effort (e.g., work hours and rework) to the local improvement group in order to facilitate analysis of testing processes and other processes in the software development life cyclequalifications we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.
 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.job analytics & reportingprimary location canada-ontario-torontoorganisation technology canada-x000068schedule full-timejob posting 10/03/17unposting date 10/05/17 please note, if you are using internet explorer this site requires ie11 or greater.

job number:j00046506toronto , ontario  cadata scientist equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. the company organizes, assimilates and analyzes data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers. headquartered in atlanta, ga., equifax operates or has investments in 24 countries in north america, central and south america, europe and the asia pacific region. it is a member of standard & poor's (s&p) 500 index, and its common stock is traded on the new york stock exchange (nyse) under the symbol efx. equifax employs approximately 9,900 employees worldwide.  some noteworthy achievements for the company include: named to the top 100 american banker fintech forward list (2015-2016); named a top technology provider on the fintech 100 list (2004-2016); named an informationweek elite 100 winner (2014-2015); named a top workplace by atlanta journal constitution (2013-2017); named one of fortune's world's most admired companies (2011-2015); named one of forbes' world's 100 most innovative companies (2015-2017). for more information, visit www.equifax.com . position summary:as a data scientist, you will be leveraging our big data environment to create and apply advanced machine learning and statistical techniques. the data scientist is essential to ensuring our continued commitment to provide quality insight to our clients and stakeholders. the data scientist position is responsible for paving the way of the future when it comes to analytics and data management.as part of the data and analytics team you will be a key player in the development of new models and solutions on a wide assortment of domain, not limited to credit risk, fraud and marketing. the data and analytics are accountable for using multiple data sources towards building actionable insight for equifax's customers.additional responsibilities of the data scientist include:- develop and continuously enhance data expertise for current and new equifax data, and provide documentation and internal and external consulting regarding optimal data utilization.- work closely with internal and external clients to understand the objectives of their projects and serve as an analytics subject matter expert leading the design of best data and analytics approaches, highlighting solutions, alternative approaches, as well as potential limitations.- assess analysis results and provide direction for proper interpretation and usage of the analytics solutions.      - develop custom analytics solutions, including statistical models, decision trees, segmentation solutions, attributes and analytical reports for various industries and business objectives.- provide detailed technical documentation of standard reporting/extraction criteria used for the analysis, as well as the actual solution.- utilize, develop and automate the most appropriate processes to increase turnaround time for analytics projects and to increase efficiencies in the statistical model-building process. - individually, and as part of the team, provide thought leadership in analytics and model building by staying on top of new developments in the field.- propose and implement improvements to actual models using machine learning techniques (neural networks of various kinds, gradient boosting, random forest, ensemble models, etc.)- manage innovation projects and meet deadlines, work with other team members.- act as a spokesperson for equifax's analytical expert team at conferences and client presentationsrequired skills of the data scientist:- proven experience designing and building analytical solutions to solve real world problems, with strong preference of this experience in financial risk area.- minimum of 5 years of data manipulation experience.- minimum of 5 years of experience, specifically in statistical/data analysis and data mining, experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modeling- proficiency in sql and at least one of the following languages: python, r- experience with hadoop technologies- proven experience delivering data analysis, machine learning and statistical modelspreferred skills of the data scientist:- proficiency in oracle sql- knowledge of database design and data modeling- experience managing innovation/r&d projects- working knowledge of at least one business intelligence tool (e.g. business objects, cognos, spotfire)- working knowledge of java and / or scala- working knowledge of sas (base sas, sas macros, sas stat, em, eg) or ability to learn quickly.- knowledge of the financial services industry and credit informationeducation:- advanced degree (ph.d. preferred) in statistics, math, operations research, computer science, actuarial science, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline.- statistics, mathematics, computer science or engineering including experience with machine learning through education or practice.                                                       primary location:can-toronto-5700 yongefunction:function - data and analyticsschedule:full timeequifax is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Business Analyst (Consumer Health) - TELUS Health
text:
job description - senior business analyst (consumer health) - telus health (hea03031-17)go to the main content section.skip to navigationpersonal business careers my accountsupportsearchsearch telus.comcareerswhy telus?search all jobswelcome. you are not signed in.|my profile optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagejob search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior business analyst (consumer health) - telus health (hea03031-17)job description senior business analyst (consumer health) - telus health - hea03031-17description who we are:
 
telus is committed to changing the way healthcare in canada works for you, your family, and your loved ones. what part might you play?
 
we collectively need to find solutions that will benefit all canadians to meet the challenge of unsustainable rising costs, long wait times and an increasingly older population. make no mistake, our journey to address canada’s greatest social challenge of this generation, healthcare, will be long and challenging – but the chance to have an impact on all canadians and build a new business for telus will be worth it!
 
the telus consumer health team will focus on empowering canadians to take control of their health and the health of their loved ones with the right information, tools and support they need to live healthier and happier lives. as a global telecommunications leader and one of the largest it healthcare providers in canada, we are well positioned to play a leadership role in bringing new services to market to address this significant challenge.
 
what you do:
 
are you up for the challenge? we are looking for team members with the capability, passion, and grit and drive to join our team as we embark on this journey! you will have the chance and expectation to engage in many different functions as we build this business and improve healthcare for all canadians. you have a strong track record of performance, you are flexible and adaptable, you are a self-starter who thrives in a rapidly changing environment and you are a true utility player who can move from priority to priority as we build out the team and business. you have a ‘can-do’ attitude and you are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done. but most importantly, you are a team player who works best in collaborative environments and understands the importance of building and maintaining an engaging culture.
 
responsibilities:


business unit and product level reporting and analytics (sales commission, reach, outcomes etc.)

scorecard governance (strategy, build/evolution, management)

lead/ support various consumer health strategic program builds, deliveries and project management

manage team continuous learning and development and support business unit level research needs (including key thought leadership articles, market/industry news, conferences and events, supporting structured product/program/business reviews, supporting the build of a lean practice culture, high-level marketing needs etc.)

support business unit planning (e.g. real estate planning, team performance management metrics, planning session development etc.) 

support development and implementation of effective business unit strategy and tactics 

contribute to and influence the strategic planning process and execution of program initiatives

able to flex in new functional areas and quickly learn and deliver 

support various ad hoc requests from leadership team and key stakeholdersqualifications required knowledge:


understanding and working knowledge of lean practices (fail-fast and learn)

knowledge of canadian healthcare environment is an asset

knowledge of current telus assets/teams on the consumer and telus health and payment solutions businesses is a strong asset
required skills & abilities:


quantitative analytics and problem solving skills with the ability to present strategic options in a clear concise manner

an entrepreneurial spirit which will drive passionate ownership, and responsibility for the business

experience leading and facilitating cross functional teams

ability to coordinate multiple projects and initiatives in the portfolio and work within an environment of rapid change

relationship management and collaboration skills including the ability to collaborate effectively in situations without formal influence & across geographies

continuous improvement mentality - challenging the status quo

strong presentation and communication skills (with experience interacting with senior leaders in a large organization)

strong bias to action with the ability to work independently to produce the required results

bachelor of commerce or similar post-secondary degree
required experience:


minimum 7 years of experience in strategy, reporting/analytics, business planning, and/or project management, preferably in the telecommunications or health technology industries
who is telus?
 
we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.
 
telus health is an it leader in canada that focuses on the health sector. our mission is to improve the way information is being used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in canada and in selected countries.
 
everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.
 
do you share our passion?  
   
at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.
 
at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  
disclaimer: in accordance with the telus health solutions data center security policy, as a condition of employment, all personnel whose job functions require they work at a data center and/or have access to detailed knowledge of technology related to client service delivery, are subject to a personnel security screening conducted through the government of canada.primary location: ca-bc-vancouverother locations: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

title: Research Analyst (Contract)
text:
multi-health systems inc. - jobs: research analyst (contract) - apply online

























all jobs
→
research analyst (contract)

research analyst (contract)
north york, ontario, canada · innovation hub

descriptionmulti-health systems inc. (mhs) is a leading developer of innovative scientific assessments and technology solutions. our assessments are used in a wide range of critical decision-making processes in every type of industry. our clinical tools are trusted to inform psychological diagnoses than can impact prescribed medication, therapy, or treatment programs. in the workplace, mhs talent assessment help inform hiring decisions, develop staff, and improve organization and team dynamics.mhs incorporates our integrity and values into all that we do. since 2013 we have been named one of "canada’s best managed companies". in 2016 we received a "canada's most admired corporate culture award". our employees consistently rank mhs high in employee satisfaction year over year. the mhs team is made up of talented, passionate and creative people who enjoy coming to work. we value diversity, teamwork, trust and open communication. did i mention, we also like to have fun?  overview: we currently have an opening for a research analyst in our innovation hub department. the innovation hub consists of a small internal skunkworks team whose mission it is to explore and develop new approaches and technologies for the assessment of a wide range of psychological phenomena.  our job is to predict trends in assessment and to make sure that mhs is at the leading edge. the research analyst will initially focus on the development of a ground-breaking product for talent assessment. this product will harness our vast library of measurement intellectual property and apply predictive analytics, machine learning and other advanced technologies to enable companies to design and deploy new assessment solutions.  this position requires someone who knows how to perform extensive literature reviews, is passionate about psychology, possesses a strong facility with statistics and quantitative analytics, is driven to learn new things, and has a comfort level with working in a changing environment and is comfortable meeting with high level clients.key areas of responsibility:  conduct      extensive literature reviews within organizational psychology and related      fields, and document findings.   quickly      become familiar with our extensive library of assessment content. perform      descriptive and predictive analytics on large quantities of data and produce      written reports of the results. work      with team members to design and develop online assessment and reporting functionality. write      code in the r language to score assessment results and produce high      quality custom reports to be delivered to test-takers and their managers. deliver      presentations to internal stakeholders and mhs customers. design      and conduct studies to collect data. requirements qualifications & skills:  master’s      degree or ph.d in psychology (industrial/organizational psychology      preferred) or a related discipline with graduate level courses in      psychological research methods and statistics. extensive      experience conducting literature reviews and writing reports. advanced      knowledge of psychometric and statistical techniques (e.g., discriminant      function analysis, regression, confirmatory factor analysis). knowledge      and understanding of test development and validation principles and      practices. proficiency      with statistical software tools, especially the r language.  excellent      writing and editing skills. ability to write compelling and engaging      content for consultants, academics, and business-minded audiences. self-directed      and confident managing own time/schedule in accordance with project      priorities.  experience      with microsoft office applications (outlook, word, excel, powerpoint,      access).  flexibility      required (potential for evening and/or weekend work). some      travel may be required. benefitshealth, dental, extended healthcare, eap, wellness, vacation, personal days

approving overtime hours and scheduled time off;

performance management – conducting performance reviews, disciplinary conversation, correction of performance issues or recognition for outstanding behavior;
training and development opportunities or requirements;
scheduling and organizing warehouse staffing and work hours to meet customer requirements;
prioritize shipments and work tasks for warehouse staff;
providing working support and to these functions on a daily basis


supervise, coach and train warehouse workforce;
meet cost, productivity, accuracy and timeliness targets;
maintain metrics and analyze data to assess performance and implement improvements;
communicate and explain lakeside company initiatives, goals and objections to members of the warehouse;
strategically plan and manage logistics, warehouse, transportation and customer services;
direct, optimize and coordinate full order cycle;
act as a liaison between warehouse staff and sales staff;
liaise and negotiate with suppliers, manufacturers, retailers and customers;
verify and maintain training certifications for all warehouse staff including whmis, forklift, general health and safety, transportation of dangerous goods, fall protection and first aid training;
analyze and track warehouse productivity, shipping accuracy, on time performance and accuracy, and safety statistics on a defined basis and report findings to the management team;
support inventory optimization. this includes, but it is not limited, to the following:

utilization of space and inventory storage in the warehouse
stock locations and usage
returns
cycle counts
inventory level accuracy


provide motivation and guidance to warehouse employees to ensure the defined expectations for productivity and accuracy are achieved or exceeded;

as a requirement for this position, the logistics manager must be knowledgeable and capable to perform the following responsibilities;
 
customs compliance 

direct, manage, and maintain overall compliance procedures to ensure that the company operates in conformity with various rules and regulations
supports, advises and communicates to the business the requirements and changes to customs regulation
operation of robust escalation procedures, including direct involvement in, and resolution of, significant customers issues
central point of contact for all customs matters and standards across all companies

 
logistics

analyze and track freight usage and maintain favourable contracts with freight companies;
modify processes and contracts as required to optimize process efficiencies and costs;
ensure all equipment has appropriate and current certification and maintenance records. schedule re-certification or maintenance requirements, as needed;
monitor and enforce high levels of quality and health and safety standards in the warehouse at all times

 
shipping 

own the relationship with carriers, brokers, and other specific vendors; such as canlogix;
arrange warehouse, catalog goods, plan routes and process shipments;
inspection of received goods for damage and count;
coordination of customer pickups, non-stock shipments and carriers;
verify packing slips to purchase orders; and
final testing and shipping of products

 
receiving

inspection of received goods for damage count;
correcting and monitoring all inventory adjustments as required;
verify packing slips to purchase orders; and
record all receiving in computer stocking system

 
quality 

keep track of quality, quantity, stock levels, delivery times, transport costs and efficiency;
follow established processes and procedures to ensure compliance with the quality management system;
identify and implement improvements based on organization’s strategic direction;
examine incoming shipments, and rejected damaged items;
comply with laws, regulations and iso requirements

knowledge of health and safety issues and regulations

hold primary responsibility for infrastructure contracts, including building leases

valve & actuator technician (guelph, on)

posted: jan 27, 2017
 
job description
valve and actuator technicians are responsible for performing corrective and preventative maintenance on valves, actuators and instrumentation equipment. they remove, repair and install actuators and perform other duties as needed.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

manual machining, including use of lathe, mill, drill for repairing and producing parts
assembly, and test of various valve and actuator configurations
knowledge of pneumatic and hydraulic principles, also piping configurations and fittings
electrical and instrumentation knowledge
use of measuring and marking equipment
use of wide range of hand, electric, and pneumatic tools
working from blueprints, engineering drawings, technical procedures and instructions
reviewing instructions, blueprints, drawings and technical specs to determine the layout, installation procedures and materials required for a job;
measuring, marking and positioning reference points for machining, fabrication and installation of actuators and other valve related equipment;
fabrication and or stock requisition/acquisition of required parts for assembly;
final assembly and testing of valve and valve automation products;
responding to valve related emergencies both during and after regular working hours;
performing instrument setup and calibration to meet specifications;
testing and replacement of defective equipment or components;
advising clients regarding standards, safety features and maintenance of the system; and
building and maintaining relationships with customers

appropriate use of the asme code

knowledge of hydraulic, pneumatic and electric circuits and first principals
knowledge of part layout, machining and shop practices
knowledge of interpretation of engineering drawings and dimensioning using vernier calipers, micometers etc.
knowledge of safe use of slinging/rigging, overhead crane operation and forklift operation
knowledge of process automation systems an asset
knowledge of asme code as it applies to safety relief devices an asset
knowledge of valve automation center’s policies and procedures and applicable tools
knowledge of health and safety issues and regulations
use of mechanic’s hand tools
use of power tools such as disc grinder, die grinder and drill press
advanced communication
computer/telephone skills
analytical skills

experience in assembling, setting and testing asme safety relief valves an asset
experience in repair and maintenance of valves (including asme safety relief valves) and actuators as asset
experience with millwrighting, machining and welding all considered an asset
experience working in an iso 9001:2008 working environment an asset

text:
lenovo data center group business development specialist - careers at pcm canada	



























career opportunities with pcm canada









careers at pcm canada









share with friends or subscribe!





 





we know our employees are a crucial part of our success. that’s why pcm canada offers competitive wages and comprehensive benefits. we also encourage professional growth and personal satisfaction among our staff members, and offer opportunities for internal advancement. join a world class team of professionals, where people work hard and celebrate success. explore the exciting opportunities that are waiting for you at pcm canada!

lenovo data center group business development specialist

 department:
vendor management tigerdirect  office:
toronto
 location:
markham

start your application
pcm is expanding and looking to add an enthusiastic, professional, and goal-oriented lenovo data center group (dcg) specialist to our team. the lenovo dcg specialist will be responsible for identifying and targeting pcm clients and prospects to promote the value and benefits of lenovo hardware, software and services.  you will be responsible for growing pcm’s national territory within our existing account base as well as driving new accounts by leading with lenovo.  this position will be supported by sales, marketing and technical support resources.  in a high level consultative role, your objective will be to build a strong lenovo pipeline and an annual run rate focusing on the mid-market to enterprise corporate customers.
responsibilities: 

developing, maintaining, and leveraging strong relationships with distributors.
meeting and exceeding sales goals while being responsible for overall account strategy development.
developing knowledge of pcm’s practices, products, and services to facilitate successful sales efforts.
developing market and competitor knowledge.
assist pcm's internal sales teams with pre- and post-sales activities for lenovo products.
educate pcm's and lenovo account managers on the technologies and resources available to them from the other's organization.
increase pcm's sales team productivity, deal size, and awareness of all lenovo lines of business.
promote all of the available lenovo program resources and tools to the pcm   sales teams.
coordinate quarterly business reviews and monthly conference calls.
provide   weekly   reporting   on   pcm's   sales (in   excel spreadsheet format). 
train pcm's sales teams to sell lenovo products using a combination of programs, including, but not limited to, lunch and learns, new hire training, and new product training.
increase lenovo deal registration awareness by providing support and training to pcm's sales teams.
review pcm's pipeline information to optimize sales opportunities.
provide feedback and guidance to pcm's sales teams around execution of lenovo sales programs and incentives.
act as first point of escalation for pcm's customers and sales teams;
participate in conference calls with pcm's sales representative and their customers to answer questions, recommend solutions, and assist with closing sales or lenovo products and services.

 
physical requirements

some travel might be required, including driving
extended working hours may be required occasionally
handling maximum of 20 lbs 
office environment that includes lengthy periods of sitting at desk, lengthy periods of standing in front of the audience, computer work and phone work
hand use (frequent)
present to the audience and speak publicly
read and write

 
qualifications (education/experience/skills & abilities)

minimum 3 years’ experience in lenovo products sales, including data center
bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
self-starter, multi-task abilities and the ability to lead in a team environment
web reseller, b2b, distribution channel, it commodity buying experience
sales or marketing experience specifically with vendor solutions
understanding of web analytics and metrics
strong negotiation skills
have the ability to develop merchandising strategies
inventory management experience
advanced pc skills of microsoft office are required (excel, word, outlook, and powerpoint)
strong communication skills
strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to multi-task, work independently and on tight deadlines and perform well under pressure
must be able to work well in teams
management experience a plus
must be able to work extended hours as needed

the role is a key member of the office of the senior vice president and is responsible for leading analytical capabilities across performance, rewards & hr operations domain to enhance data driven business decisioning.  the ideal candidate will demonstrate ability to decompose complex problems, possess strong analytical acumen and have a high level of intellectual curiosity.  

key accountabilities 
analytical expertise

perform analysis to provide relevant, credible and actionable analysis to inform business diagnosis and action 
present and communicate data analysis in a clear and compelling way to business audiences, at all levels 
support production of pr&o centre of expertise reporting to centre of expertise domain leads and senior hr executives 
this includes mining hr data, extracting trends, generating graphs and charts, adding business specific context and ‘telling the story’ to provide executives an overview of the general health of their business, key opportunities/challenges and support decision making
change and innovation

contribute toward new development and/or enhancements to hr analytics and technology, defining business requirements and working with various groups across hr to provide feedback and suggestions, participate in design walkthroughs and end-user testing to ensure delivery according to specifications. 
proactively identify opportunities to enhance reporting to elevate insights 
work with hr stakeholders and support implementation and change management of new hr technology within pr&o to ensure optimal effectiveness and efficiency. 
participate in the hr division community of practice.
leadership and team effectiveness

devises ways to streamline processes and is able to break down barriers that spark new and effective processes and ideas 
responsible for managing multiple projects simultaneously and resolving conflicting priorities and objectives
relationship management

build ongoing partnerships hr, coes and business stakeholders at all levels to ensure business needs are met related to hr analytics 
within the context of the assigned project, responsible for building and sustaining day-to-day relationships and communications in conjunction with team members, with stakeholders at various levels of the organization, including executive level, as well as other internal and external resourcesqualifications knowledge & skills 
skills

highly developed and proven consulting, change management, project management and strategic thinking capability

process oriented and extremely analytical. 
expert knowledge of data mining

excellent research, analysis and communications (written and verbal) skills 
proven ability to implement strategic vision 
highly developed impact and influence capabilities 
developed leadership capabilities 
results oriented and able to work under minimal direction 
solid stakeholder management and influencing skills at peer level and 2+ levels up 
sound business and technical acumen 
solid presentation, written and verbal communication skills which bring clarity and precision at various decision-making forums
knowledge

possesses a university degree and/or 5 to 7 years relevant work experience 
possesses intermediate knowledge and 3 to 6 years of experience in data and analytics, hr experience preferred 
excellent knowledge of ms office including word, excel and powerpoint

key accountabilities
 
financial and business analysis

review financial results to ensure completeness and accuracy on a timely basis 
provide future-oriented analysis to project short, medium and long-term requirements in a timely manner to acceptable quality standards.  
identify and/or critically assess opportunities for profit improvement, determining the financial impact of initiatives/ strategic business decisions, and incorporating impact into future financial forecasts/plans.  
work with the business/function to align key performance indicators with the financial forecasts/plans 
ensure financial forecasts/plans reflect any changes in the internal and external business environments 
work with the business and functional partners across bmo financial group to resolve issues and solve problems, ensuring solutions are consistent, aligned and supportive of business and organizational goals. 
managerial leadership

establish a strong two way working relationship with finance peers within your group to maintain highest quality governance, drive talent development and deliver on overall group finance objectives  
optimize group finance performance through collaboration, communication, and clarity of accountabilities. 
work with finance shared service teams for reporting, planning and forecasting requirements, setting appropriate context and driving continuous improvement 
client & relationship management

build strong relationships and provide value-add advice to ensure that the business/function financial needs, goals and strategies are understood and incorporated into financial strategies, plans, forecasts and initiatives. 
participate in the strategic planning process of the business/function, utilizing an in-depth understanding to provide recommendations. 
manage the coordination & analysis of financial and operational highlights of the business/function including financial reporting, forecasting and planning, ensuring the continuous improvement of financial information presented to senior executives and consistent, standardized reporting across the business/function. 
act as a finance subject matter expertise to support the design, development and implementation of initiatives/projects, understanding the requirements of the business/function within the overall group strategy. 
work with the business/function to develop, maintain, manage and report key metrics to track and analyze performance against commitments. 
ensure the effective implementation of bank initiatives and programs for business/function by providing relevant information, establishing goals where applicable and measuring progress against goals/commitments. 

risk management, control, and financial governance

co-ordinate financial governance, compliance and attestation reporting where applicable. 
provide finance specific subject matter expertise to the business/function in the assessment of the financial performance and the condition of the business/function and attestations. 
review financial information for reasonableness and flag areas of interest to cfo and business/function leader to ensure results are understood and opportunities and areas of concern are properly addressed in a timely manner. 
ensure financial integrity of financial plans and forecasts
change & innovation

support the operationalization of business/function change initiatives to ensure optimal effectiveness and efficiency from a finance perspective. 
collaborate with finance colleagues and lead/support changes within the finance teamqualifications qualifications

undergraduate or graduate degree in business, economics, engineering, or science/math discipline is required 
accounting designation is preferred, but not required – ca, cga, cma 
10+ years’ experience in a finance function in financial services.   
excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present ideas to all levels in a clear, concise and compelling manner 
strong relationship management skills.   
strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices, financial reporting, and financial analysis.    
demonstrated strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with senior management, team members and other internal/external colleagues  
demonstrated ability to work on problems/projects where the field analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors 
flexible, adaptable and highly motivated 
sound judgment and decisive with an ability to prioritize competing demand by applying practical and analytic approaches to problem solving 
professional team player who thrives in a dynamic environment 
we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

title: Senior Analyst - Research and Development
text:
senior analyst – research and development (j0617-0145) - johnson - job details

senior analyst – research and development






position id:
j0617-0145


job type:
permanent full time


job location:
toronto, ontario, canada


division:
actuarial


region:
head office


job category:
actuarial


number of positions
1





keeping you moving:
rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development.in rsa, employing people with a ‘winning mindset’ is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers.  our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader.  also rsa’s bwow (better ways of working) provides everyone with the flexibility of working where it best suits your needs – downtown toronto, mississauga or richmond hill (and even from home).
position overview:
the senior analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.
who you are:
your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo.  you find solutions to problems.  you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations.  you get things done the right way.  you represent our brand with passion and pride.  you are a team player.  you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you.
what you will achieve in this role:
•	develop new predictive models to be used for pricing, underwriting, claims, marketing etc; •	drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques; •	design, build and maintain market-leading cost and behaviour prediction algorithms; •	communicate complex technical models and results to colleagues in the business and provide recommendations;•	develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; •	investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes; •	contribute to the development of winning pricing and business process improvement strategies; •	engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results
what you bring to this role:
•	university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics;•	minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience; •	technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; •	out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next innovation;•	proven ability to turn innovative insight into implementable value-driving business solutions •	demonstrated success in people, project, and relationship management;•	knowledge of property and casualty insurance; and•	outstanding communication skills (both oral and written)#li-rs1
other information:

title: Senior Analyst - Research and Development
text: rsa | career opportunities ­ français contact us home / career opportunities / senior analyst – research and development job details addthis | email favorites linkedin facebook twitter senior analyst – research and development position id:  j0617-0145 job type:  permanent full time job location:  toronto, ontario, canada job category:  actuarial year(s) of experience:  posting date (dd/mm/yyyy):  20/09/2017 closing date (dd/mm/yyyy):  20/10/2017 keeping you moving rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development.in rsa, employing people with a ‘winning mindset’ is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers. our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader. also rsa’s bwow (better ways of working) provides everyone with the flexibility of working where it best suits your needs – downtown toronto, mississauga or richmond hill (and even from home). video: working at rsa position overview: the senior analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams. who you are your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo. you find solutions to problems. you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations. you get things done the right way. you represent our brand with passion and pride. you are a team player. you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you. what you will achieve in this role • develop new predictive models to be used for pricing, underwriting, claims, marketing etc; • drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques; • design, build and maintain market-leading cost and behaviour prediction algorithms; • communicate complex technical models and results to colleagues in the business and provide recommendations;• develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; • investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes; • contribute to the development of winning pricing and business process improvement strategies; • engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results what you bring to this role • university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics;• minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience; • technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including insights derived from advanced analytics to help retailers and manufacturers drive sales growth and boost profitability. using comprehensive fact bases of purchase data, precima's experts help you improve your marketing and merchandising, identify opportunities for growth and align both internal teams and external partners to best meet shoppers' needs precima tailors the scope and pace of its solutions to the unique priorities of each client. the overall goal is to achieve not just tactical wins but long - term strategic gains, encouraging retailers to broaden the marketing agenda and fully explore the potential of sophisticated shopper insights. precima's roster of past and current clients includes many leading fortune 1000 brands, among them some of the top high-frequency retailers in north america. backed by firsthand experience with leading retail and manufacturing organizations, the precima team brings a remarkable blend of expertise in loyalty, analytics, marketing and management to help you make more informed and profitable business decisions. • this role is within the precima team.• this position is located in toronto. about the roleas a data and technology co-op, you will provide value-added insights to precima clients through the design, development and implementation of complex database systems. you will carry out data sourcing, transformation, logical/physical modeling, and etl/elt development to support deliverables across multiple database projects.these solutions will support the business objectives such as marketing strategy development and execution, merchandising/category management plans and ad hoc strategic and tactical client issues. the consulting & technology team is responsible for the development and implementation of technology to support and enable profitable product, pricing and promotion decisions in support of partner customer strategies. they will influence strategic direction by ensuring analytic activities are developed in line with business objectives. they will contribute to the success of corporate objectives by developing cutting-edge solutions in support of customer-based marketing strategies responsibilitiesparticipate in kick-off meetings for production projects to ensure alignment across data, analytics, client services, reporting services/deployment and other key stakeholder groups.gather requirements through internal and external client meetings. incumbent will develop robust technical specifications in conjunction with the client team and technology partners.data modeling to ensure accuracy and efficiency of data relationships within reportsdevelopment and maintenance of advanced database, etl and bi solutions.work closely with lead and sr. developers in client deliverables.work closely with bi reporting team to optimize data preparation and flow of reporting deliverables work closely with analytics team to incorporate output of statistical modeling in databaseparticipation in business reviews to ensure understanding of retail business processes and productsprovide a consultative approach in delivering relevant ideas, solutions and results to title: 
                        
global hr reporting analyst (successfactors)
                        









 

requisition id: 8187
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job
this role will play an integral part in the deployment and support of a new cloud based hr system as part of a global hr initiative. this role will be take part in a wide range of activities and project phases of the reporting workstream, executing requirements gathering and data mapping and supporting with reports design, build, and testing.
 
key job accountabilities

support requirements gathering for global hr reporting and produce relevant requirements documentation and sample reports for the future state
provide input into system/data design and mapping from a reporting perspective
assist to explore and track the technology capabilities of the new systems/tools as it relates to hr reporting (i.e navigating the systems as a reports admin)
help build reports in the native applications using report designer/admin tools
impact analysis on reports due to source system changes
support the technology stream leads on any local country details and requirements on data. 
ensure alignment with global integration/data team is informed with data decisions that have impact on global hr reporting
provide input to local country data retention activities from a global hr reporting perspective
augment from a reporting perspective in collaboration across the various streams (translations, reporting, data, integrations and application streams) based on needs of the project.

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies

experience with success factors applications including employee central, recruitment, onboarding, pension and benefits with a focus on native reporting tools from successfactors (e.g., advance reporting, ad-hoc reporting and online report designer)
understanding of critical hr process (e.g., data administration, recruitment, onboarding, pension and benefits, payroll)
experience as a business analyst/consultant or hr super user/sme (3-5 years+) defining and documenting business and technical requirements
proven ability to analyze, document and communicate complex technical solutions to non-technical parties
must be a self-starter and effectively work under limited supervision
strong analytical and problem solving skills
strong interpersonal, communication (oral and written), and presentation skills
experience with sap payroll is considered an asset
experience with wfs is considered an asset
familiarity with hadoop analytics/other bi tools an asset
spanish fluency is an asset (nice-to-have)
intermediate knowledge of microsoft excel, word and power point

 
education and other requirements

post-secondary education in a related field such as business, hr, payroll, benefits, compensation, it systems, business analytics/reporting

 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
